iG-xIA_TnkjfzHH9-lXYhQ.text: Needed a quick eggs and grits breakfast on a busy Sunday morning and got it! Service was great and the atmosphere was all families and friends. Every table and booth was full when I left at 9:30am. Coffee was hot and strong, grits were perfect and I was able to make it to my grandson's baptism on time. Noise level was a bit on the "loud background" level due to a large turned-on TV mounted at ceiling height about 15 ft. from my table but since I was dining alone it didn't matter. I'll be back for lunch and breakfast whenever I'm in Charlotte.

photos.caption: Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. View from the booth.
Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bar area and open seating

Ai94Z8XUcwKo2XkInrFyIw.text: Thanks to Yelp, we came across this place for breakfast and had to give a try. It truly didn't disappoint at all. The service was quick, the food was adequate without being overly large. Great family place and seems very popular with the locals. I think when we come back to the area, we will go again.

photos.caption: Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Smoked sausage and cheddar omelet with cheese grits
Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken florentine omelet special

v1n9T1I7efCLHfzkLrUtcA.text: Had a great prime rib dinner last week. Miss Julia was an awesome bartender and a great conversationalist.

BZHB96B1HovVnaa7rxTifg.text: I totally get it!  This is a charlotte staple and I see why.... we'll I'm not sure if it is a staple( made that up)  but eddies place most certainly should be!   I came for brunch with friends and stayed for the drinks.   At 12pm sharp the crowd started cheering.  Let the drink service begin!  It was a Bloody Mary kind of day and I'm so glad it was... their bloody Mary's are perfectly spicy salty and strong! The food. MMMMMM! Fried chicken biscuit and gravy!!! Yes a thousand times yes! And that's all you really need to know about the food! Well ok a lot of other great things on the menu.  My hubs had the chicken and waffles which were all type of perfection and our friend had the chicken fried prime rib and breakfast burritos which I didn't try. The ambiance isn't anything fancy but it ways I can't explain, adds to the charm.  The sassy hostess was adorable and the service was great!  Price points aren't too bad  So much for my new year resolution diet!  But Eddies Place was worth it!

GBLo61zr71BY5qc71yOrEg.text: Saturday brunch is the best!! Awesome service and excellent food. You'll probably have to wait to be seated but it is worth the wait.  Guys get a Man-mosa. Invented here and excellent way to get your Saturday going.

1GgvuTq-_STenQB4dTSXGQ.text: This is a very nice place to eat. It is very popular so expect a wait. We had a late breakfast or early lunch. The food is delicious.  I met a regular diner and she told me the best items on the menu...I must confess she said everything was great. I plan to return to this restaurant. I now know the secret to getting a good seat at the bar.

_zVbcXWD65j3EQGmB6lrSQ.text: The wife and I love going here. Breakfast is always good and the lunch items are tasty as well. Service is good. You can always tell a good place to eat when there is almost always a wait. They serve lunch and breakfast all day as well keeping everyone happy. You have got to try the biscuit and gravy!

xGBvaj6RQDH234pUUSyz6Q.text: I took Virginia's recommendation with the chicken fried breakfast.  Great place for breakfast and when I come back for lunch or dinner I will update this. I don't think you can go wrong with anything you order the couple next to me are regulars and showed me everything that is good.

1bRSy_DNnK3lAdTLNoFTdg.text: One of the best breakfast spots in Charlotte!   Omelets are perfect and the hash browns are great.  Coffee is just ok, but the good will get your mind off of that.  Make sure to get the creole sauce on the side with your omelet, delicious addition!

photos.caption: Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States

r_3vhvuF2ZzREydretOHZw.text: This place is always amazing a staple restaurant that I have visited for thirty years. The burgers, and the Parmesan grits are my favorite items on the menu.

QHNFfuA7ZBu_1VkLaMKtig.text: Found this place on Yelp and decided to check it out since the reviews were good.  I went on a Sunday and this place was packed.  Be prepared to wait.  Since I was by myself the hostess recommended I put my name on the list at the bar.  My bartender Ben was a really nice guy and very personable.  He recommended one of the specials and I'm so glad he did.  It was delicious!  I ordered the Chilaquiles (traditional Mexican dish) with a side of liver mush.  I really enjoyed it and recommend everyone to try it! Now for the negative stuff.  Management needs to staff another person behind the bar during breakfast/brunch hours.  I waited about 15 minutes to even get a cup of coffee and then he gave me a menu.  Another 15 minutes go by for him to get my order.  So a total of 30 minutes from the time I sat down and finally ordered.  With the wait you guys had, you should have been flipping my seat ASAP.  It's not Ben's fault that he had no help, management is the one to blame.  The bartender does spend a little too much time talking to guest during a rush, but could you blame him as he has been neglecting tables?  He handled the whole bar, cashed out servers, ran food, took to-go orders, etc....I felt bad for the poor guy. I'll give it another try in a few months.

tBLDocjsNVJhWJ3xaTs2fg.text: First time here & family enjoyed the breakfast. Service was quick and waitress extremely helpful. Fiance wasn't a fan of Parmesan grits, but waitress promptly noticed & provided him with regular grits. P.S. My daughter loved the Parmesan grits! Will return again for lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Loving those grits

eHGPk41HIIJLhmpSEFQMug.text: If I lived in Charlotte, this would be one of my go-to spots. It's a perfect place for Happy Hour or even weekend brunch. It does get crowded though so there may be a little bit of a wait. Fortunately, the bar was open when I went. The staff is pretty awesome, and they were accommodating when my friend and I changed our orders last minute after seeing someone else get their waffle chicken sandwiches. There needs to be more places like this in the world!

photos.caption: Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. That waffle chicken sandwich though..

hmnB78Ct9Hloma4n9cX_XA.text: Chicken and waffles are a must, and don't forget to order their Mac and cheese (insanely good). AND!! don't miss first call on Sunday at 12pm... The bartender (Ben) is a character in the best way possible and is very attentive. You're lucky if you get a seat at the bar! And the mimosas! They pour an entire mini bottle of champagne in the glass, add a splash of OJ, and then drop in a cherry.  If you want great service and delicious food, go to Eddie's.   PS - They serve breakfast all day

photos.caption: Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Blackened chicken omelette

CzbZd9BdkIAZt3w_Nqgfug.text: My husband and I checked out Eddie's place for breakfast on our short weekend trip to Charlotte. We had no wait which was awesome. The Ciabbata French toast was good, the pancakes were excellent and the Chicken and Waffles were the best we've ever had. The Bloody Mary was pretty delicious as well. Our waitress, Ginger, was attentive and incredibly helpful in providing us with recommendations for places to check out in Charlotte. We definitely recommend this as a brunch location!!

UW1zGx2lmZfyrXnNhZXp2g.text: The service here is always great. They would keep refill your coffee. Great place for breakfast and they have lunch too. Breakfast is all day. Parking can be tricking. The best time to go is very early or during the late afternoon. I usually get the omlette. You choose the toppings you want on your omlette. Pancakes are good too come with a side and a choice of meat.

lSujwI3Bfe9gy9oyXrtQ8A.text: We got a eggs Benedict which was  amazing  And grits which were pretty average but still good. The service could have been better, we had to ask for coffee multiple times before we actually got it. Seating was comfortable and it had a great brunch/lunch atmosphere. This is a great place to eat and is one of my favorite breakfast places to go to.

zTyk8c5Jwn19GsGlMXmd1A.text: Great homely/family environment. They are open till late and serve breakfast all day. Chicken and waffles is definitely my favorite.

ZSeH-DyGayqMdcbTeazIJw.text: Came here for breakfast while in town visiting family. This place was awesome. I had the cibiatta french toast with smoked sausage and the wife had chicken and waffles. Great food and service. Highly recommend.

IwaYFzg3tWtoPlzoAj6tqA.text: Love those Boston Clams  The Boston clam chowder is close to the best I have eaten. It has a smokey flavor due to the bacon and is more full of clams than any other to me.   They are proud of their Reuben. It tasted good, but there is way too little beef, just two very thin slices. Because of this I'm dropping a star from my rating.

photos.caption: Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. I took this shot of a slice of the corned beef used on my Reuben.

TFD2e31Tt_z_6QrPD2Gl2A.text: Came in Sunday afternoon and had a great meal. Started with She crab soup(excellent).  For the meal, I ordered shrimp scampi with a side caesar salad. The shrimp were tasty cooked perfectly with a smooth sauce over the linguini. We also ordered a burger with cheese and mushrooms and onions. The burger was very juicy and had an excellent outdoor grilled flavor! The service was personable and she offered what I needed before I asked. I will come here again!

photos.caption: Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp scampi is very tasty and the noodles fit perfectly in their dish. I loved the smooth flavor.
Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Ceasar salad is great! Not too much dressing and not too little dressing, just perfect.
Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. She crab soup! If you come here, you MUST get this.

U1d288z4C_7l-L4YK0i8Bg.text: I would like to give this place 4 1/2 stars (I very seldom give five stars).  While this is not fine dining it is a place to get good food, at a reasonable price with good service.  If possible get there early as they tend to be busy during the rush times.  It has a clean, unpretentious atmosphere.  The food is fresh and things are done in a timely manner.

WCxiILSAXjW1hZtMb_1tcw.text: Great neighborhood restaurant. Nice menu selection. Food is always good as is service.

NZg6sTg7SsYOabP6FUTWYA.text: I love the atmosphere in this place. Rustic yet slightly chic with a comfort food menu. I love she crab soup and was told it was the best anywhere. Of course I had to try it. Well maybe I shouldn't have added the splash of sherry because it made the soup taste sweet. To be fair, next time I will try it first minus the sherry to see if that was the culprit. Other than that, everything else we ordered was excellent.

hOG96a7UVxnBur3himJuEQ.text: I stopped in to eat at Eddies Place for lunch with my parents on a Saturday. We waited avout 20 minutes to be seated. Our waiter was super nice. I had the she crab soup for starters. It was fantastic! For my meal I had a cheese burger and fries. It was really good. I cant wait to go back.

K74tr7Sa8LqOXcAJyY33hA.text: The food was fantastic, but my service was horrible!! Server did not give me water after asking three times. It's unacceptable to not even have the minimum of water for 30 minutes. Many people sat after us, and was served before us. Great food but service...

kwZf-QpcKdC4N4_QoGlC_Q.text: As a native of this city I'm somewhat ashamed to admit I've just now eaten here.  Better late than never though!    What a gem.  Sure, its parking lot can sometimes be a landmine, sure it's not the newest shiniest gemstone of a dining establishment and you know what?  I'm good with all that because I just had probably the best Rueben I've ever had alongside some of the best hand cut fries.    Top off the delicious food with a dose of pleasant table side manner and viola!  Achievement unlocked!    It might be called Eddie's Place but now it's My Place.  That's right My Place (I'll concede my naming rights with a handshake from Eddie himself only).

HJ28gT4Z9jouvQTLVOTjhQ.text: In a town with great sports bars, Eddies is a quality establishment. Friendly service, clean and not overly expensive. Breakfast Burrito very good. Don't love the location inside a row of stores with decent but not great parking. Will be back.

pw1XLXPcuiy4hjpWSWKNjQ.text: My favorite neighborhood spot. Best wings and burger and she crab soup in town! Very family oriented and relaxed.  Been going there for almost 20 years!

We7TAEw3x9ubj1LGMvVD3A.text: I was lucky enough to be in Charlotte for Tuesday night prime rib!!! My family had to roll me out of there! The service was so wonderful. We had a family of nine. They seated us right away and took the time to walk us through our desires to try nearly everything. The prime rib was PERFECTION. The shrimp and grits absolutely killed it. Kids and adults were super happy. Everyone left happy, full and still talking about our wonderful meals!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States

fkLD7u1MbW7-mZwvuA2Kjw.text: Hands down the best chicken parm I've ever had! I once got pancakes which was delicious but the chicken parm blew me away!!!

DLNPC_BRNA7ucLRm-cm_2w.text: The wait was pretty long at lunch time for Sunday brunch, but it was a party of 8 with 3 children. They also sat us about 20 min less than they initially said. Wait for a party of 2 was only about 30 minutes. The noise wasn't too bad, and the service was great. The server gave us wonderful suggestions and even took a photo for the table! The fried pickles were a perfect starter and their house ranch is amazing!! Chicken gumbo had fried okra with a thin/smooth roux and so good, but had a little spice to it. The bread it came with had a salted crust which was the right compliment. Smoked Gouda and Bacon Mac is the greatest creation! We all enjoyed our entrees. Definitely a perfect go-to for brunch or just great food!

photos.caption: Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp Po Boy on Ciabatta
Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Creole
Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken &amp; Waffle with cinnamon honey butter

_0jUY2eG9u5ti_z21_HKnQ.text: The she crab soup is wonderful and the red beans and rice was very good this is a do over.

-RfUR1MH0DsZONc32P0YEA.text: The food is great. Service is good, too.  However, it's difficult to enjoy any meal when the air conditioner is set to what feels like 40 degrees. The thermostat should be set for the diners, not the employees.  This is not an isolated incident.  Our group may not be returning, in spite of the good food.

kQj_XclIoW3y1QvjPPNM_A.text: I just love this place, it warms my soul! The fried chicken breakfast is my personal favorite thing on the menu although the SheCrab soup is something to drive out of your way for! Make sure to stop in here, it's kinda a locals spot. My only negative is that the parking is rough because the lot is shared with so many businesses and it's small. Eddies does have daily Specials that they change up monthly as well!!

photos.caption: Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Amazing

nf0OyaOAcUdSfylERWPDfQ.text: Ordered the flounder po' boy. I got a huge piece of delicious fried flounder. I think there was some bread somewhere on the plate but I don't remember. Smoked gouda bacon mac n cheese was my side cuz  I make good life choices.   Had to try the She Crab soup too. Very tasty. Highly recommend taking full advantage of the sherry dispenser they give you. For some reason it takes that soup to the next level.

CByM7snsiwXgGX55_F-SqA.text: This is my going place whenever I go brunch with my boyfriend, they have the best French toast in town. I have been come to Eddie for more then 4 years and enjoy my very visit. Appreciate they offer new speciality!

ctCp-uK3BdSyZ2-QG61PmQ.text: People need to stop finding out about this place. We used to come here all the time when we lived in the area and came back on Saturday morning around 8:30 and it was already packed. We usually prefer to sit at the bar because the bartender is awesome. If you have the chance, sit there! We were seated in the only open spot which was right behind the hostess table. First off it was freeeezing. The service was painfully slow. I never saw our waitress and the place looked understaffed. The hostess was not very organized and a bunch of old guys stood awkwardly close to us waiting for their tables and kept telling the hostess about empty tables. The coffee is always good, and my hash browns this time were very undercooked. This experience was 1-2 stars but for old time's sake I'm leaving 3.

photos.caption: Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Biscuits are amazing
Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Butts right next to our table

QvPgtILn8kVDrwlhKX8PVw.text: My absolute favorite place in Charlotte. I bring all of my out of town guests here. The she crab soup is the best thing in the world!!! Their Reuben is amazing. But let me tell you about those shrimp and grits. Oh. My. God. Delicious, simple, and fulfilling! I also really enjoy their potato salad, it's not a mustard based potato and it is just super delicious.  I love this place so much that I send so many people here. I work down the street and whenever I'm asked where people should go grab some food, I ALWAYS say Eddies Place. They have specials as well, and ALCOHOL. them so much.

IUlikUzd-MTbL5A8El69hA.text: The service here was amazing! I loved their brunch menu and I'm so glad they offer It all day! Highly recommend their ciabatta French toast and mimosas. Perfect brunch place, get there early before the rush on Sunday mornings!

VkGquVzwlWmEok7NlheQmw.text: Yep, I'm giving Eddie's one more star! My mother and I were out shopping yesterday and I was craving soup and remembered Eddie's having an awarding winning she-crab soup.   We ordered two cups of soups and a pulled pork Cuban sandwich, sweet tea and I went for a PBR.   The soup came out first and let me tell you -- we were so happy at the fresh crab meat and savory thick broth... it was amazing. They also bring you some sherry wine to drizzle over it.. DE-LISH. I of course had to put some Tabasco in it... That will be a cold day/night go too!   Thank goodness we shared the sandwich, as it was HUGE. It was really good. The bread, pork, ham, cheese, pickle... yum a great version of a classic Cubano sandwich.   We ordered a bowl to go and had them wrap up our left over sandwich and made sure to feed my father! ha!   My mother stated she really preferred this establishment over Briggs as the ambiance is refreshing and casual and not sterile like Briggs...   So Eddie's it is again. Thank you for the yummy food and great prices! My mom laughed that my PBR was cheaper than her sweet tea. :)

BrXyeo4I2QZ_vOjk3LvT1A.text: Picture this, you are sipping on a hot cup of coffee reading the morning paper and you are eating a delicious plate of pancakes. Well, that is exactly what you can experience at Eddie's.  Eddie's serves just what you want from a casual restaurant for breakfast. The best part about it is it's not a greasy spoon. (They also serve lunch and dinner.) You can be in and out within an hour, or you can take your time and read the paper front to back...either way, we haven't felt rushed.  The hashbrowns are okay (little squares of potato), the grits are good, the bacon is crisp, the coffee is bottomless, and the pancakes are delicious. The servings are plentiful, the service is fast, and everyone I see leaves happy and full!

EWFZp3TZkmsCP8mcX-8OtA.text: Came on a busy Sunday morning.  It's a nice little diner style place - casual, not quite dive-y - with delicious French toast and surprisingly tasty hash browns.  I say surprisingly because when they come out, they're these funky little cubes that look like they might have come out of a bag but then they surprise you with how tasty they are - they're cooked with some onions and they're good.  Bacon was also yummy.  The low point would be the coffee - hot enough but it tasted a bit weak and as though it had been on the burner for a bit too long.  Granted I got decaf so it might have been the brand, but still.  Before we got the check, I'd have given the place three stars. But then there's the fact that this place is SO CHEAP.  Seriously, when you can fill up a pregnant woman and a grown man for under twenty bucks, you've got it going on.  X-tra star for X-treme value!

XM-Gdz9p4D4sQ6k_vzjf2w.text: Excellent place for an omelet.  Whether you order off the menu, or make your own, you will not be disappointed. The servers can help you craft a perfect omelet, always cooked to your specs. My favorite is the veggie omelet with feta, but hold the olives please.  For those of us that hate the chain/franchise restaurants, Eddie's is the place to go for a solid breakfast.

fYSpg2ffya9x3mW_5Qm5gA.text: Just simply a good place for unpretentious brunch ( and lunch and dinner too... but I eat mostly brunch here)  The menu isn't fancy, but the food is prepared well, and they usually have some interesting specials.  The Steak and Eggs is fantastic as is their Shrimp and Grits. Decent Bloody Mary's - which is a must IMHO.  Can get very busy, although I've never had to wait more than 15 minutes.  My only complaint is their coffee. It's awful. I can usually suck down a couple of cups if I need it, but I'm never happy about it.  It simply confounds me when a perfectly good breakfast joint doesn't have the wherewithal to serve decent coffee.  Doesn't stop me from eating here, though!

X0srvvQVi2ORS7L1kSQVAA.text: My wife and I were looking for a place to have breakfast one morning and when we saw the number of cars in the parking lot around Eddie's we knew that this had to be a place to check out.  The place was crowded, everyone seemed happy and we headed to the bar which was a first come first serve section.  I had the French toast, side of bacon and hash browns which were pretty fantastic and my wife had an omelet which not only came out perfectly but made us want to come back here again.  One of the best parts of this experience was however, the breakfast and a show.  There was a little boy two seats down, maybe 7 or 8 who was having breakfast with his dad.  He also had the french toast but quickly cut it up into bite sized pieces, arranged them neatly around the edges of his oval shaped plate and then poured a pool of syrup in the middle.  One by one those pieces dove off the edge until the plate was finished, the little boy full and my wife and I completely entertained.  Now I can't promise he will be there every time you go to Eddie's but I can promise that breakfast will be good!

f4LJqw-LD-Nnksej23K9_A.text: My husband and I moved to Charlotte about three months ago. We've been searching for a good breakfast/brunch place for some time (we had a favorite in Northern Virginia that we really miss). With that said, we finally found it - Eddie's Place!  The outside looks like a dive but don't let that fool you. The inside is actually really trendy and, while there's usually a wait for a table, you can typically go straight up to the bar.   The bartender was attentive, helpful with the menu items, friendly and a big part of the reason why we're giving them 5-stars.  I had a basic egg sandwich but they have a lot of options to make it "your own" and it was delicious. My husband had an omelet which was perfectly cooked and full of flavor. He also had a mimosa and they aren't skimpy with the champagne!  For sides, I had cheese grits and my husband had the hashbrown casserole. GET THE HASHBROWN CASSEROLE!!! Seriously, it is amazing!  I can't wait to go back!

iL4ewnpLdzNpM4fpAb6Tvg.text: Gouda Mac and Cheese with chili. Delicious but ruined my diet for the day!! It's always nice to chat with the regulars as well.

XtxArb0DrecyyZTpnV1lSQ.text: Friendly staff, delicious down home breakfast!  Biscuits- heavenly. French toast- spectacular. Coffee-hot, good and plentiful. Love to find locally owned places to spend my dining out dollars.

Rc9T0wwC94TD1-LArX9F7w.text: Order 3 egg omelet, French toast, waffle turkey sausage. Everything was great for tourist. The service was outstanding

PMusDZTwlNAhBpQX3qQXdg.text: Good, reasonable food. (beer too!)   $3 copper on draft? $7.75 wings? giddy-up.

YfLklWpqISbKW8HCzXuWlA.text: As long as you know what you're signing up for, this place is great.  It's not fancy by any means but offers delicious food and pleasant service.    The She Crab soup is terrific and the bread that comes with it is incredible - it's served warm and is soft inside with the perfect amount of lightly crispy crust!  The Po Boys are served on the same bread (I suggest asking for a side of mayo and mixing the mayo with Tabasco and then adding it to your Po Boy).  Also notable are the pancakes - which are perfect - fluffy and tasty! Just make sure you don't miss the soup!

_zdpzAjMfT44Wm-8DHgM5Q.text: I've been to Eddie's a few times and feel like I can't give them an honest four stars until I try their bloody mary... I've had brunch at Eddies 3 times now, service has always been great, and food has always been pretty standard (good, but not remarkable). If you are an early riser, you can get in and out of Eddie's in a snap, but don't wait until noon on a Sunday and expect not to have a 20-45 minute wait. I really think Eddie's is deserving of a 3.5, but I vow to give their bloody mary a try... depending on how that goes, I may up my rating to 4 stars.

tU1I5sBwyIY9ikF5kyCSOg.text: Let's be real. I visited Eddie's Place because it had a great name.  Eddie's also has awesome food. I got a breakfast sandwich with smoked sausage & cheddar cheese which was DIVINE.  You'll definitely want to get a side dish if you get the breakfast sandwich (I got grits) - but the food is really good portions. A breakfast sandwich + grits + OJ was the perfect meal for me.  Put it this way - I joined Yelp just so I could give this place a good review. You should go there.

NEUGxGMQj9AO5B5nQ5itKg.text: Eddie's Place is my favorite neighborhood place. For breakfast I love the omelette. For dinner burger or red beans & rice.

bpjIEU4uYOm0GY-os5wccQ.text: I grew up eating at this restaurant, formerly known as "Eddie's Place, Danny's Too", ever since I was about 10 years old when I would take piano lessons next door. Even though I moved out of Charlotte a couple of years ago, whenever I come back home to visit my folks, I have to make a trip to Eddie's Place for a hotdog, pasta salad, gumbo, and fries.   Hot Dog - juicy & big. what more can you ask for?  Pasta Salad - tangy and garlicky. i've tried all sorts of pasta salads around the country, and even dining in Los Angeles or NY where the world's most renowned eating establishments are, I have not found a more perfect pasta salad than the one at Eddie's Place. Yes - it's THAT good.  Gumbo - this is a great cajun gumbo with a nice kick to it. the rice and the sausages are cooked to perfection, in addition to the soft and tender okra that soaks up all the flavor of the soup. must try!  Fries - I live on the West Coast now, and I still think about Eddie's Place fries from time to time. They are crisp, salted just right, and sprinkled with fresh black pepper. As a kid, my dad would let me get an order of fries after every piano lesson, and many times I couldn't wait until after my lesson so I would convince my dad to buy me some beforehand...  I hope this place stays in business for a very long time!

T46bOF8FiAav-ZPnwkRSTQ.text: My wife and I have been to Eddie's Place a few times for breakfast and we have never been disappointed. Service is great and very friendly. The specials are a great way to really enjoy breakfast at Eddies.

aDCbB5idtF5zcqfsdFzLcw.text: Excellent.  Simply put. Fresh homemade everything. Staff is incredibly kind and efficient. Lunch menus are wide ranging with daily specials. Their wings are the best in town. Cobb salad is always crisp. Habanero ranch dressing is the best. Highly rwcommended.

pAOjWCVNjRZCm-AzvgJw6w.text: Came for a later breakfast last Saturday w/my sister and one of our nephews.  We had a very brief wait, no more than 5 minutes.  Our 6 y/o dining companion LOVED his kids menu featuring his favorite cartoon character, Spongebob.  He did a great job coloring it and was very excited to hang it up on the wall.  Our server was really nice, as was everyone else who approached the table.  Food came out really fast, which is always great when you've got kids with you.  I got a bacon, egg and cheese on a bagel and we all split a side order of pancakes.  Nephew got kids french toast and bacon, sister got same as me.  We enjoyed all of it, and the growing boy who had already eaten earlier in the day, cleaned his plate then started on the pancakes and claimed they were his favorite part of the meal as he scarfed them down.  Prices were great here and the menu looked like it had a lot of other things I'd be interested in trying.  Oh and the mimosas being served look delish!  Will def be back.

yx7E-3ZJZzKlR7FrCncCwQ.text: This place has been around for as long as I can remember....well, as long as I have been in Charlotte...15+ years.  Great breakfast food - which is served ALL DAY!  The staff is super friendly.  I have never had a bad server there.  I went in recently for the first time in a year or so and it looks like they have updated the interior.  Very nice!  They could use a few more big TVs.  But, a great little neighborhood bar with yummy breakfast food anytime!

z4eF3NHLIbjg5zP7h2cMaw.text: Ben the bartender is awesome! Chicken and waffle with honey butter is to die for. Best I've ever had. Everyone is so nice there and it really has a great Charlotte local vibe. Best hangover food around.

iC1uY9KHEM-xeUX6FfFJmA.text: They got my order completely wrong. The food wasn't anything special. At the price you might be better off going to one of the larger chains.

l3yVrieE_Med-chLyOsQ9A.text: Ate at eddie's after a night of drinking after an intense biscuits and gravy craving. Quaint little place, plenty of parking, very friendly host and waitress. We ordered chicken fried steak, with eggs, biscuits and gravy. It was perfect, steak was seasoned and fried to perfection. Their white gravy is just right, and biscuits fluffy like they should be. Great food, and friendly staff. Can't go wrong.

Wva5cG2KkCWULUQJ-2--6A.text: Open on Sundays and serving breakfast every day of the week!  Full bar!  We went for brunch and the omelettes are great, bacon is crispy and my diet Pepsi remained filled.  The hashbrowns are the homefry style which I'm not really a fan of but next time I'll just get grits instead.  This is a family friendly place with regulars that have been coming here for years.  I'm happy to say I'll be coming back pretty regularly now too.    Plus Rebel Base Comics & Toys is right next door so I can kill two birds with one stone.

eIi5ueFjV_VYIBU6Kp6NOg.text: This place serves breakfast all day and great southern food.  I've been here a few times and gotten a steak sandwich marinated in coffee and brown sugar, a reueben and also french toast bignets.  All three were very tasty.   Good food, and good service.  I wish the TVs were a little bigger, they still have old school CRTs, but they have specials on beers every once in a while.  This week they are doing $1 PBR, $1.50 bud light/ miller lite.  Can't really go wrong with that. It's one of those great places where you know what you want, but at the same time, everything else still looks good so you have to kinda force yourself to stay with the first choice.

tlpeaYXtQJ8Fs8iFEtoX_Q.text: "Oh look honey, it's a dinah!" I mean, what do you give a diner in the realm of stars? A diner is a diner- a greasy spoon to be precise.  I love Eddie's because it's a diner: clink-clank goes the dishes with the occasional football game or jukebox run in the background and a bustlin atmosphere.   The soup is what's up.  There is always a special running and the slight shift in ambience as the day progresses makes it a coffee-to-bloody mary-to-beer kind of joint.  Pop in, pop out, be fed.

do1uK4-Ni4wUkMamGF2nnQ.text: Used to go there years ago and it was always good...but think it has even gotten better. Went the other day with my girlfriend sat at the bar and ordered the bartender was great. They forgot to put the ham on the ham and grilled cheese when we informed the bartender she went straight back to the kitchen. Thought she was going to take the cooks head off. The food was great and one of the best parts about I is you can order a half order of anything. 20 years ago I could have eaten full portions but they serve so much food it's hard for me to eat it all. The service it's great and another great thing is some off the long term staff they have you don't see that in many restaurants. They ask about your kids and friends I used to go in with.  Go ther for the food but the service is a big plus

2gkICsmO3IuapOj0KQBu_Q.text: I had chicken and waffles It was my first time trying it. I really liked it, the Belgian waffle was good with some sort of flavored butter it is served with. I really loved the coating on the chicken, I believe it was some sort of pecan crusted chicken and it was really yummy.

WVF9gt2TGUThtOFC_8BfAQ.text: Food was ok but we had to wait 35 minutes after ordering the breakfast specials to be served. Tables seated after us on each side of us were served ate and paid before we got our food When we asked about the wait we were told they were not too busy and had adequate staff and the wait wasn't that long. Won't be coming back

Ez8DxhYe74lsWbJRZr0gdg.text: Amazing French Toast! Stopped in on a weekend trip to Charlotte due to positive Yelp! reviews, and it did not disappoint. They serve breakfast all day in this local spot and it was delicious. Everything that came out around us looked great. The hash browns were simple, but tasty, the bacon was quality and the french toast could have been the best I've had.  I overheard the bar tender talking about their lobster dinners that they do a few times a month, and I really wish we had time to come back and try it. I believe he said $22 for a recently live (They kill to order), Maine lobster with roasted potatoes and corn on the cob. We might have to plan our trip around that next time.   The decor is nothing special, but definitely feels local and cozy. The staff were very attentive and not overbearing and the meal came out very quick.   Definitely give it a try!

r5AyjmGDLD8vSBH6xvr2pQ.text: I had breakfast with my little toddler. We ordered hash browns, French toast, and sausage. Everything hit the spot. This will become one of our regulars for a quick and easy breakfast.

vyWODUcb97WtFPrxxNIsaQ.text: Another tucked away breakfast spot in the suburbs of Charlotte.  We have been here a couple of times and their breakfast is yummy yummy.  I recommend making an omelet!  Or the eggs Benedict is really tasty.  Everything tastes very fresh, their waitstaff are very polite and prompt.  There is a long wait on the weekends unless you get their at the right time, timing is everything with breakfast in Charlotte it seems.  Pretty good prices, a bit higher than say IHOP or Cracker Barrel but it is a local business so I'd rather put my money their.  Try it!

oSNiXzM4SR70Cxmi_4k9dg.text: My sunny side up eggs came out picture perfect and the eggs Benedict was scrumptious!! Food came very quickly and the staff worked together well to make everything run smoothly

NXxNScLgYPB0UinfvwBlKQ.text: When my buddies come into town and want to hit a good burger joint, this is where I take em. It's a nice little place, and the food is excellent, they serve all types of things and all of them I hear are great. Everything I've tried has been top notch. I recommend the fried pickles and some type of burger. They have a good selection of beer too if you're into that kinda thing.

K_btEkDs4Ib0tz1PjT9CKQ.text: If you want a classic neighborhood traditional breakfast with a Cajun twist, Eddies is the place to go.  If you don't want spicy and just want the basics, they have that also.   My favorite is the vegetarian omelette with feta and Cajun salsa.   I had a waiter recommended it over a month ago and I keep going back for it.   I love their biscuits but don't get them grilled.   Don't expect the fastest or best service in town but that's part of the experience also.  Enjoy.

9vA66x_qWFuOtVY4iCU16Q.text: You'd never know by the outside that this the best brunch in Charlotte. The chicken and waffles are amazingly delicious, cheese grits needed salt but are fabulous. $5 mimosas and bloodies hit the spot. Not bad of a wait, definitely worth it.

O-ujgFB3VkYBwdlEgh24jQ.text: Fell in love with Eddie's Place for breakfast. They have the best bacon, egg and cheese sandwich I have been able to find since moving from NYC. Also a huge fan of the fries here. Have I ever mentioned that I love eating fries with breakfast?   We decided to go for dinner one night when we couldn't think of anything else so we decided to give this place a try for dinner. What a good choice it was! First, it was $2 bottled beer night and there were some good choices! I went with the grilled chicken sandwich on cibatta and it was the best chicken sandwich I have had in a really long time. The husband had the chicken parm and also said that it was delicious.   The service is always good and for some reason we always end up seated at the same booth which I like- now I don't think I want to sit anywhere else. it's so nice to have a place like this near the house. This is def a great spot, especially for those nights when we can't agree on anything else!

BCox6aQufyXrP8wv5EU6Vg.text: I have eaten at both locations of Eddie's many times. The service is typically good (especially at the Cotswald location) and the food is generally very good. They have many great specials -often with sort of a low-country or New Orleans flair - and they do fish dishes really well. However, I am happy many times with just a bowl of the she-crab soup... it is fabulous!   They often have fish dishes as a daily or weekly special and these are usually served with a nice accompaniment of veggies and/or pilaf.   When you are in the mood for a good sandwich and french fries, they also have many options in this direction.  I used to love their breakfast anytime - but the last couple of times I chose b-fast, the  omelets were sort of bland.   The Ballantyne location is usually pretty crowded for breakfast/brunch on weekends, so expect a bit of a wait there. But, they have complimentary coffee while you wait so that helps!   Overall, its a good place to go for comfort food.  2011 UPDATE: The Ballantyne location is now closed.

ntrq_Cr8GgTx7JCt_sKiqA.text: Simply the best value, best food and best atmosphere ever!  I have been going to this restaurant for over 15 years, and it just seems to keep on improving.  The dinner specials are amazing -- where else can you find FRESH grilled fish with 2 vegetables and a salad for under $20.  Want an awesome omelette for dinner, or pancakes, no problem.  The staff is laid back yet really attentive to what's important.  Don't be surprised to see the same people there over and over again.....it is truly a community gem.

UsekpacX9obWkEPHsXT6lQ.text: This is our neighborhood spot that we love and hold dear to our hearts.  We've become acquainted with many of the staff and other customer's that frequent the restaurant.  It's almost like like going to "Cheers" for us.  And hey - the food is awesome too!  The country friend breakfast is one of my favorites if you don't choose to go with one of their awesome weekend breakfast specials.  I also love the mushroom swiss burger and fries (you got to try the fries).  The gumbo and muffuletta (warmed) rock too!!  Only bad thing is there's sometimes a wait on the weekends for breakfast, but isn't that a good sign for a restaurant??? just sayin!  Enjoy!!!!!!!!!

vIj4DO3OZUcxaKATk--qow.text: In a few words, the food was worth the wait.  I came here for brunch this weekend.  It was a 20-25min wait around 10:00am.  They don't do call-aheads, so you just have to wait it out.  Our name was called...time to eat!  We sat down and were immediately greeted by our waiter.  We were in the very back of the restaurant at the end of the bar near the kitchen, where it was surprising quiet.  With Food Network playing in the back and people watching in the front, there was plenty of great views from that area.  There is nothing special or fancy about this place...just your standard restaurant decor.  Service was super slow, from getting coffee refills to actually getting our food.  They were busy, so I wasn't expecting service to fly.  The food finally came and it was pretty darn good.  I got a basic breakfast.  Scrambled eggs, ham, hashbrowns and a biscuit.  Everything tasted as you would expect.  We also got the country breakfast with fried chicken/gravy on top of a biscuit.  If I wasn't trying to watch my diet, I would literally order that meal every day.  Gravy: A+.  Fried Chicken: A.  Biscuit: A.  Mimosas and Bloody Mary's are $5 each and come in a wine glass and pint glass.  Tip: They won't seat you until your full party is there!  Also, the bar is first-come, first-serve in case the wait for a table is too long.  Overall, great brunch food.  I feel like I finally found my brunch fix in Charlotte.  I look forward to eating through the brunch menu because it just looked that good.

photos.caption: Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Nice basic breakfast of champions. Two eggs scrambled with lots of sides

GTUpjVQkW-j4cb289AOVhQ.text: My wife and I had a nice brunch.  I had the Rueben sandwich with the coleslaw and it was fantastic!  Nice waitress also very polite and very professional.  My wife had a breakfast with some delicious hash browns and a sweet tea.  Overall a very pleasant experience.  Come during the week.  It is very busy on the weekends!

c36kxLI2cq7TzSMi8uyPCw.text: This place is fantastic!!! I went with my grandfather and fiance and they told us that there was a 25 minute wait, but a server caught us as we were walking outside and said there were 3 seats at the bar and we'd ordered in no time! The food came out quickly and was delicious, and the service was great. Will be back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States

73Hml7U-ulrIIGp0XEvgAw.text: Went for Sunday morning breakfast.  Got the crab cake benedict special.  Honestly the crab cakes were just ok; had a little shell in it.  It was served on a biscuit, but I think I prefer an English Muffin.  The parmesan cheese grits were the best part of the meal . . . very rich & savory.  SERVICE (1 star): Regarding my waitress, once she brought out my food, she never checked on me again.  Didn't ask how the food was, didn't check on my drinks, etc.  When she returned my credit card slip to pay, she said "Here you go."  I replied "thank you" and she didn't say anything else.  I've been in customer service industries my entire career.  I thought you thanked the CUSTOMER for their business . . . otherwise, you wouldn't have a job or any business.  Needless to say, disappointed with the service here!

BVRBGXXiNl4humqtW8MmBg.text: So we kept hearing how great this place is for brunch and I would say that I wasn't a fan. We ordered a couple mimosas, the French toast (which comes on Ciabatta bread), pancakes with a side of eggs, Turkey sausage, and hash browns (with cheese and jalapenos mixed in). The French toast and pancakes were nothing to write home about (Cracker barrel pancakes still hold the number one spot in my book, until another establishment shows up and out). The eggs, sausage, mimosas and hash browns were good/standard, again nothing special. They do have other items on their menu that I heard was good and I'd be willing to give this place another chance ONLY because of the customer service we received. Oh and I heard their waffles were good so yeah I'll be back to try other things, just wasn't impressed with the pancakes and waffles.

photos.caption: Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Just brunchin&#39; around! $5 mimosas (mine with a splash of grenadine)

o9bLdjNXvkiv73hRGRP4YA.text: Great for a diner-type breakfast. I've never had anything but. Good coffee. Great pancakes. Nothing fancy. Consistent.

rBzJanotbtKEHEF5OGBHMw.text: I LOVED Eddie's. We happened upon here by accident on a Saturday morning and man were we glad about it. We showed up around 10:30 and waited for less than 10 minutes to be seated. They are very busy so you should expect some sort of a wait. They are a no-frills traditional breakfast joint. They don't even serve iced coffee! Which is fine, there are enough brunch places in CLT, sometimes old school is better.  I got a veggie omelet with hash browns and a side of pancakes, boyfriend got chicken and waffles. We were both very pleased but he was FLOORED by the chicken and waffles. It looked delicious even to me as a vegetarian. The cinnamon sugar butter was freaking unreal.  Eddie's definitely has a local neighborhood feel. The waitstaff is very friendly. I look forward to returning and trying more of the menu!

Hoaff-Ib7HV9S1SgJUfJlA.text: If you are in Charlotte, you have to try this place. Nice place to hangout with friends. My favorite and recommend items - She crab soup, rib special Tuesday, Country fried breakfast, sea food platter, shrimp and grits (this one might be little heavy, but a worth try) Party with drinks and food

z-7cmHbq4MT4yg-u2I0UBA.text: Our new go-to breakfast place!  A little cramped, but super delicious!  Everything was hot and cooked perfectly!

Jm-s2l2zCAMrvZoDqeKFlA.text: My son had the ciabatta french toast sticks and I had the chicken and waffles. The chicken is pecan crusted and the honey butter that come with it compliments it well...just a bit too sweet for me. But it was good. Loved the butter on th waffle...no syrup needed.

photos.caption: Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States

119xd4J13p13HCAb6ASkZw.text: Food is as advertised, GOOD!!! Love the bacon, my girlfriend was enthralled by the "She Crab Soup" coming back for the Reuben.  The service was great and the nap I took afterwards was even greater!!

photos.caption: Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States

bOOnafz3SV-g1dlMuNOwAw.text: I love this place. Where else can you go and debate between chili dogs, country fried breakfast, or cajun pasta. Food always hits the spot, and the staff is insanely friendly and attentive, which is a dying breed with the new wave of restaurants. A True staple for me.

hFmpQl030QUvxrxQYfrP1w.text: Pancakes and Syrup! Pancakes and Syrup!  This place is easy and laid back. Breakfast all day!! Great for the kiddies and bar foods pretty darn good. Beers and Cocktails are flowing nicely too. There's a good bit of TVs to catch most big games and events and there service is prompt. I do enjoy this local place.

2Sr3lJbfR3qrzLoe2YyE0Q.text: I don't know what it is about this place that just feels so right. I used to live in this neighborhood years ago and coming here for a late night snack or to go food... night cap just feels so right. Friendly staff, great staff actually and food is always what I want. Great place. Chill and honestly home away from home.

e4FoJTuFTXxORxX6FG8Wlg.text: Food was on point and cost was reasonable. The service was beyond excellent. Our server (Waffle the Physicist) was so thoughtful and engaging! This may be my new after the game spot!

gadwFAo9zPzCg7Bl6CZHPA.text: Went here this Sunday morning around 9am.  I was stunned at how crowded this place was on a rainy, Sunday morning at 9am, but I guess this place has a loyal following in the area.    As you can see from my pics, I ordered the breakfast burrito.  It came with red beans and rice, salsa, and sour cream.  Because I was feeling a little hungry, I also got a side of hashbrowns and side of bacon.  To be honest, I didn't find any of the items I ordered to be anything special.  I'd say the bacon was good - crispy but not burnt.  Otherwise, I'd say the hashbrowns and breakfast burrito were just OK at best.  My issue with the breakfast burrito is that it was somewhat small, lacked seasoning, and the salsa def wasn't made in house.  Go to Toast for a better breakfast burrito.  The hashbrowns as I said, were just ok as well.  Its not that they were bad, I've just had waaay better at many other establishments.    The best part of my dining experience was the unbelievable and friendly service I received from the gentleman running the bar this morning.  He was quick and efficient, and got me in and out quickly given how crowded it was.  Although the food was just ok, I saw many other entrees being served that looked very appetizing - perhaps I just ordered the wrong thing.  I'd def like to go back and try a few other menu offerings such as the create-your-own omelet, steak and eggs or chicken and waffle.

photos.caption: Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Side of hashbrowns and side of bacon
Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Breakfast burrito w/chicken
Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Breakfast burrito w/red beans and rice, salsa and sour cream

HEKePC_SUmWtwu93NkW8AQ.text: Stopped on my way to chorus rehearsal. From the outside it looked like a dive, so I didn't know what to expect. So I was more than pleasantly surprised when I got inside, and then even more by the food. I live 50 miles north, in Statesville, but will definitely stop in next time I'm in the area.

UygnjNFDCFrNEz9w_8lE0g.text: I am so confused! I attempted to make a to go order at 11:33pm and was told they don't do to go orders after 10pm. I am not sure how this business practice makes any sense. You have to cook the food if I eat it here or if I take it to go. If I eat it here and don't finish it, it will then be to go. I am just confused!

HGJ23zAc3ezZPKQ6PI1VPg.text: This is a nice little place for the locals to enjoy. I was seated as soon as I walked in the door. Our server (Chad) was very personable and attentive. As for the food.... It's love in the form of food! :-)   The Chicken and Waffles were wonderful and paired with some cheddar cheese grits, you're in for a food coma. The infamous "Ciabatta" French Toast was my poison. You can pick two or four, but trust me two is enough.  Did I mention, they serve breakfast ALL DAY! I encourage anyone that hasn't tried this place yet, to swing by and try it out... You will not be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Creole dish with Smoked Sausage
Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Red Beans and Rice
Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken and Waffles with side of Cheddar Cheese grits.

WZIsBRn0aV2JVKHJZyAOag.text: So this review is really on the food because our waitress was just ...awkward. But considering the guy that greeted us when we first sat down was so friendly and seemingly good at his job, I'm not going to downgrade this place for hiring an awkward but cute girl maybe less suitable for the gig than her predecessor.   Skipping straight to the food then...I was feeling soup and salad that day and my babe was craving breakfast food so this seemed like the perfect spot for the both of us to try. He got the chicken and waffles and I nabbed a bowl of the she crab soup everyone has been talking about and a side salad with ranch. As I think we can all agree the chicken and waffles were pretty dang delicious. The waffle had the perfect texture, the chicken delightfully crispy and the flavored butter on it was the perfect touch. The soup also proved to be a good choice. I tend to like a little more sherry flavor in my she crab but considering we are inland this was rather impressive tasting. The side salad was a little brown in places and was missing the spinach that the menu had promised but I cared a lot less about that once it was slathered in their scrumptious ranch.  Bookend this trip with another couple awkward encounters with our waitress to get our check paid and we STILL left the place satisfied.

photos.caption: Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bowl of she crab was great, bread was a bit of a throw-away though
Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. House salad missing spinach and a touch brown but that ranch more than made up for it
Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bowl of She Crab and a house salad with ranch

LLURsdMMo2jeA73_JtQh5A.text: We were just stopping through and had the best lunch ever! The food was fresh (wifey had fried oysters).The server was accommodating that checked from which coast came the oysters and even had the cook fry just one to be sure she liked it. Also told us the best way we could travel with the she-crab soup (you must have this!) because we have to take some with us! Well done Eddie!

3THMS07vP6yO58NISLfkDA.text: Great varieties of beer!! The staff makes you feel like a regular, even on your first visit! Unpretentious food that delivers on great flavors. With the prices affordable enough to visit frequently.

lIgwLuXe0cVXIB1TTcfNtQ.text: After all the good reviews, I had high hopes for Eddie's Place. Most of the breakfast was ok. Nothing to write home about. If you like grits, I don't recommend ordering them. I was looking forward to them because it's something I only get when I go out to eat breakfast (which is rare). They were very watery. I took two bites and gave up.

XD47aiFeNtAB_al-9n7CKw.text: Breakfast is always good. Homefries lack. Friendly service and atmosphere.

LsQcuZn0ramfjU3fJirtyQ.text: I like this place, it kind of looks like a dive from the outside and inside but the food is really good. I like the Shrimp Boy and She Crab Soup. Their french fries are home made and delicious.

zOh28LKX7uQbaD9pOuQM8A.text: This place is good for every meal, plus they serve breakfast all day long.  The menu offers breakfast, sandwiches, and for dinner they have several different entrees.  The menu has a loose New Orleans theme (they sell muffalettas and poboys) that is decent, but I would def reccomend the poboys over the muff.  At night this place turns into a pretty cool bar.  Be careful when you go because the crowds can be crazy, especially for breakfast/brunch on the weekends.

DyFFAta2mdwU9q4bTDmonA.text: Eddie's Place  is a great place to grab a good breakfast, especially a Sunday Brunch.  The omelets here are really good and you have a lot of choices as far as what you want to go in them.  The chicken wings are also great, as are the hash browns...umm the has browns are really good.  I have to admit one of my favorite dishes here are the frog legs, similar to chicken wings but bigger, a little stringier, and way juicier, with a slightly different texture and a different bend to the drumsticks (you'll see what I mean), but the flavoring is superb.  Oh the Muffaletta's are very good here as well.  Check it out, Eddie's Place a  great place for Breakfast, Brunch and Lunch.

hz8LRKL2xaunX7boLQdaPw.text: Another entry in the best burger bracket in the Observer.  I stopped here on Saturday for lunch.  The restaurant was busy with several groups people waiting.  I managed to grab a spot at the bar.  Ben, the bartender was very friendly and took good care of me.  I order the burger which comes with one side.  I was going to get fries and then a side of onion rings.  Ben said they could do 1/2 fries & 1/2 onion rings as a side.  It took a long time to get my food, but the kitchen was doing a good job of keeping orders flowing.  When I got my burger the people sitting next to me at the bar said I should take a picture of it. It did look very good.  The burger is fresh not frozen and had the standard setup, lettuce, tomato, onions.  Ben let me know when I ordered that they could cook my burger any way I wanted.  I ordered medium rare and the burger was closer to rare, but that didn't matter.  it was juicy and tasty.  Both the fries and onion rings were fresh not frozen.  The onion rings were awesome.  At $11 for burger, frings (fries & onion rings) and a beer the price was right.  I'm definitely going to have to go there again as they have some nice breakfast items which they serve anytime.

buDIMHaEYko_4W3w2lzxiA.text: This place is great.  It's a locally owned and opperated buisiness, which I love, and everything you order comes out better than you'd expect.  I love their breakfasts, but the she crab soup is worth ordering.

atOTJ2SH8pr8dIU__zzUKA.text: Recently went to Charlotte for a weekend shopping trip and was excited about the prospects of eating at some new places. Before heading out to the Ikea on Sunday we decided to find a breakfast/brunch place so we dialed up our Yelp. The reviews seemed pretty favorable for Eddie's Place so the sig-o and I decided to hit it up. We got there around noon and only had to wait about 15 minutes for a table. The place is pretty small and probably not that amenable to large groups. We were immediately escorted to a table near the front of the restaurant in a little nook with several booths and tables. It didn't take long after we were seated to realize that we were near the most raucous group of people outside of an Ozzfest concert. Although I am in my late 20s I immediately had a glimpse of what a 70 year old woman feels like while admonishing a group of teenagers. But I digress. The table was fully stocked for just about anything you needed for breakfast (jams, butter, creamers, syrup, hot sauce, ketchup). We ordered coffee which was just OK. I ordered the breakfast crepes which were stuffed with eggs and bacon and covered in a jalapeno cheese sauce. The bacon was very salty and I had to mask this with some syrup. The crepe itself was average. I have had much better crepes at a Vegas fast food joint. The hash browns with the crepes were also a bit overcooked. I also tasted the sig-o's french toast which was decent but nothing spectacular.  You really can't mess up french toast anyway unless you burn the hell out of it. The waitress was very attentive and friendly so service was definitely not an issue. Nothing during my experience here was terrible but nothing was extraordinary either. Really can't comment on their lunch/dinner menu but breakfast was very average. With so many other places to try in Charlotte I doubt I will be headed back here anytime soon.

PzZQEdPL5-dLnzImpyoyyA.text: Greatfood in a casual setting. The only drawback would be the wait on a Sunday morning.

NtAobAfGOXr9k4lD5ODC6Q.text: Great breakfast place. Expect it to be busy on the weekends. I've had varying success with service. All of the food is good, no tremendous standouts but nothing subpar either. It has character which is something not a lot of places around Charlotte have so that's certainly a plus!

WUIpz3X0SvRsF2-sQqPJ0g.text: It's a very long wait to get a table, especially on the weekend. You can find yourself waiting for over 30 minutes. The sitting is very tight and cramped. I ordered the steak (MW) and eggs scrambled. However, steak came out bloody and it took the server 10 minutes to circle back to our table to get me a new steak. I had a friend with me that had the same order issue, she however just ate her steak.  Service poor, food okay. Probably won't be going back in a while.

photos.caption: Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States

0qCikrT7qsF8Xg-p-XKwOA.text: As some others have said, where have I been? After reading some reviews I decided to head to Eddie's this past Saturday for breakfast.  I arrived shortly after 11:00 and there was a line outside, which is always a good sign. I put my name in at the door, but was told if I wanted to sit at the counter I could put my name in their too, depending on what comes available first.  The counter was packed, but only one person ahead of me.  Within 10 minutes a spot came availbale and and Ben called me over.   The counter reminded me like Cheers, all usuals and Ben remembers everyone. He provided me with a menu, took my drink order and brought me a water.  I chose the Bloody Mary which was great and I proceeded to enjoy two! As for the food I ordered a three egg omelett, which allows for unlimited options.  I chose ham, peppers, onions, mushrooms and swiss which a side of parmesan cheese grits, hash browns and a biscuit.  The omelett was huge, but mainly egg, not a lot of veggies inside.  The hash browns were awesome with a nice crisp top and soft in the middle. As for the biscuit, not your typical biscuit, but served fresh, hot and to my liking.  I enjoyed the company at the counter and the service, as I said Ben and the staff are on top of things, and will definitely be back. I also though the April specials looked great so I might have to check out their dinners too!  Make sure your plan for a wait or be willing to jump in at the counter if a seat of two opens up, which I thought was the way to go.

photos.caption: Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Three Egg Omelet, Parmesan Grits and a Biscuit!
Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. April 2015 Specials Board

lX11j6lCa3xYD2nhw34EwQ.text: I've gone plenty times and I have not been disappointed once. I would recommend going early for brunch to avoid an at best 15-20min wait. The oysters are love. The burgers are amazing. The Chicken & Waffles and French toast are bananas! The menu overall is very well priced. Certainly a Charlotte trademark.

2AZ0Hr45W21wl4JBncietg.text: This is the go-to spot for my husband and I. Great salads and great breakfast! I don't really try too much other. I've had some delicious pasta once. And my best friend loves the chicken sandwich. I absolutely love this place. Friendly staff! Great service! Inexpensive. And you can order online!

4Xp_SMruV-RvMnXNko_X6w.text: Eddie's has the perfect American breakfast. It's my favorite breakfast place in Charlotte, and there are so many menu items I wanna try. Unfortunately, I'm hooked on the chocolate chip pancakes (which I highly recommend) and so I haven't yet tried many other items! Definitely check out this place--it's simple, yet amazing, and try those pancakes!!!

wDoTrkfeurRzxJvu51oGTA.text: Stumbled on this restaurant by accident, but returned multiple times because of the great food and service! The first night I had the Cajun Chicken and my friend had the Seafood Combination. On the first bite, all we could say was yum. We found out they had breakfast and returned for the Eggs Benedict and Bloody Mary. The cheese grits were phenomenal and the livermush, a southern favorite was nice and crispy. While we were there we chatted with the regulars and found out it was a neighborhood hang out. I think their neighborhood just got larger because I will have to go back many more times!

Bc0yYJGhVrTDsIoHo1ukUw.text: Have been here before, great food. Went there this morning and was told there was a 20 minute wait, 30 minutes in a realized people that got there less than 10 minutes ago were being seated. I went inside and asked where we were in line and they told me I was next. Then three groups were seated after this. I left after this.

Wf-WtmkV6Ag0uoDKd3g1Fw.text: "Tom, you gotta go to Eddie's place!  OMG, Tom, it's awesome!"  I heard this non stop from not only my sister, but from my mother.  "We need to go soon, before there is an hour wait!!"  OK!  Shit!!!    After our Black Friday shopping was done, we decided to go to Eddie's (as I would be leaving to go to Wilmington shortly after) for brunch.  It seems like everyone must have still been shopping, because when we got there, we were able to be seated immediately.    One thing I noticed- I was shocked at how this place is a bar and a breakfast place as well.  And it has been open for 15 years.  They must be doing something right (as you sometimes hear about a lot of places that go out of business due to the fact they have an identity crisis, and lose tons of $$$)!    They had a normal menu, and a special brunch menu.  I can't even remember what I had, except I do remember dousing hot sauce on some hash browns.  I know I posted photos- and I am sure you will be able to tell which one I ate (it's clearly the unhealthiest out of the 3 pics).    I remember the food being seasoned well and coming out fairly quickly, considering it started to get busier as the day progressed.  I was saddened though they did serve PEPSI (yuck).    This place is definitely a solid place for breakfast, and after seeing the prices on some of their beers, I would have to come back and see what that's all about!

eqjhF2kW8w9UkxkpVQxnCg.text: Went around 4:30 on a Saturday, was relatively busy but we were seated immediately. The decor was beautiful and fit the ambience of the place. The staff was friendly and spoke to us when we entered the establishment and left. Our waiter was amazing and had great recommendations for our taste. Can't wait to return to get another batch of the shrimp and grits! It was decadent!

b3TH31IxwEvAW7U9X3G1CA.text: I love this place, but the review is honest. If my peniis got better with time, so can you guy's menu.  ==== FOOD =====  SHE-CRAB  For me the food is only "ok" at best. I tried the "she-crab" soup everyone rants & raves about and is on the menu's "Gotta try" list. Eh...wasn't memorable to me. Was fishy & came across way too many shell fragments. I am a seafood lover. I married a blowfish, for-crying-out-loud. What guy wouldn't?  SHRIMP -N GRITS  You're killing me guys. This is a simple dish. This is down South. If you can't cook good grits, leave them alone. The 'plain old good grits' factor is completely missing from this dish. The shrimp.....ugghh. ..come on guys...sauteing shrimp is not complicated business. Lightly season, marinate 30 minutes, pat that shit completely dry and toss in a hot oiled pan. Five minutes later, magic  What the hell is that red greasy crap you put in my grits? Chorizo? You guys really pissed me off with this dish, that's super simple to cook. Yall need one white or black Southern person cooking the local dishes. We ain't gotta wash 'em though! Hoo ahhh!  MAC 'N CHEESE W/ BACON   Sounds appetizing as hell right? Nope they dicked this up too. Possibly the greatest American comfort food, just ruined. Is it edible? Yep and that's it.  RUEBEN SANDWICH W/PASTA SALAD  Um...freaking delicious. Not the best I've had. I'm not used to it being served on square loaf bread but hey, it was pretty on point and the pasta salad with cubed veggies in a sweet/sour base was the perfect compliment. Recommended by Jesse. Thank you very much.  WINGS  Fried crispy without having to ask. Sauces? Pretty decent. Can't go wrong with the wings. A bar favorite and mine.  DRESSINGS   OMG. THEIR HOMEMADE DRESSINGS ARE SPECTACULAR. The first time I tried the blue cheese I accidentally punched this old broad off her stool. Not poop but seat.  FRIED PICKLES  Grrrrr...they're chips not spears. Grrrrr...Everyone knows spears are better. I mean, have you seen Britany's boobs? Balloontastic.  BREAKFAST   Never had it. Have heard everyone there brag about it. I asked Jesse what'd they serve. He said, 'Oh, regular breakfast stuff.' Lol. I believe they serve breakfast all day.  ======= DRINKS  AND PEOPLE =======  Why I come here. Ask Jesse to recommend you something. You won't regret it. What? The freaking  bartender stupid. God I really dig the people here, the way the bar is laid out. Always love outside seating of course. Jesse's a good guy. If you don't sit at the bar, you'll miss why people become regulars here. I'm really gonna miss this place when I leave Charlotte. Dammit.

WRXV16JIvgtV-J0igqAofg.text: My mom actually found this place, I don't think I would have even spotted Eddie's place from the road. We've been here a few times now and always enjoyed it. I've only had the breakfast and it's good. Nothing too fancy, but they have a lot of options, simple eggs and bacon and even more fancy daily specials. After seeing a few of these reviews, I think I need to go try the Ruben soon.  The only issues to point out are, this place gets really busy on the weekend mornings. It's busy and not the most relaxing place. With that aside, this is a great little spot, good food and kind, speedy service.  I don't know of a similar type of restaurant close by. Definitely give it a try.

lU2Yo-Vr2YkRw80r2jwRqg.text: This used to be one of my favorite hangouts but it's not the same Eddies Place anymore. Sad

qREhDVjNow7rAlgS2ZA-AQ.text: I was told about this place and decided to check it out. Glad I did! With only a 15min wait for a table (I could've Sat at the bar for faster service) but I have a good book and wanted to stretch my legs. Anyhoo, the waffle with homemade cinnamon butter was awesome. My belly is swollen with yummy goodness! Eggs scrambled with cheddar cheese, bacon and a side of hash browns w/onion. Mmm mmm good! The service was fast and efficient and my good was hot.

photos.caption: Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Waffle Breakfast with a side of hash browns!

9hBq9UzbhvGTYU3rwlzYQg.text: Stopped here for breakfast around 9. There were 2 in our party and we were seated right away. The menu offers fairly simple breakfast items, but everything comes out quick and fresh. My eggs were cooked to order, the toast was of good quality. The home-fries were good, but could have stood more seasoning.   Overall, it's a very nice spot for a reasonable, well cooked breakfast. Friendly staff and warm atmosphere too!

sSiSuVxezvujzDf6KDADLw.text: I got the fluffy pancakes and hashbrowns and cheese grits as my two sides. It was okay - food arrived quickly and the service was good.

dFvkjYxUfMpd84F9o2L4NQ.text: We have come here twice now and every experience has been the same. Friendly staff, quick seating (15 to 20 at the most), good food and decent prices. They give you a wonderful neighborhood feel and their wait staff treats you like they know you. You can not ask for anything better.  We love this place and they are our new breakfast spot.

RPp4Fp7FkJ44mBu7OjL5uQ.text: If you want a typical American breakfast, then this is the place for you! Everything tastes good in its most basic form. The reason why I gave it 4 stars is because I really enjoy trying different things. If you want something traditional then go here!

rJyI6ez07GMMamxI3ynHvw.text: The Prime Rib on Tuesdays is amazing.  High quality food in a casual environment.  Great menu with a touch of creole.

40PkK9_NJ8m1nOuxZCmXxg.text: Apparently I've been living under a rock because I had NO IDEA Eddie's Place existed or that they have $1 per oz Prime Rib Tuesdays! With a minimum of 6 oz, you get green beans, mash potatoes a side of au jus and bread with your meal. I always get medium rare and the meat is so tender, flavorful and just melts right in. I mean honestly, where can you find such a delicious dinner for this price? If you're gonna have about 10oz or more, just get two 6oz dinners, that way you'll have double the sides!

jm3eNdRL_aii2bNw9b2arA.text: Came in for a late lunch, not sure what to expect. Bartender (Jessie?) was awesome. Super friendly, with great knowledge of the menu and beer selection. Food came out relatively fast and the Muffalata sandwich was excellent.   Warning! The Muffalata is a MASSIVE sandwich. When given the option to get half or whole, get the half. I guarantee you wont even start the second half. But it is delicious, so dont be afraid to get it!

FD04VghDEIRLsndu2WnhFw.text: 6/6/17 Brought my daughter here after her graduation. The salmon special was excellent. My husband's steak was cooked as he wanted. My daughter's cajun pasta was delicious. The cup of clam chowder was on point. Our server was attentive the whole time. Everything was cooked very well. It has been a while since the food has come out with no issues.   9/26/16 I have a love-hate dining relationship with this place.   5 months ago Visited on a Saturday around noon for a late breakfast. Seems like there are new waitresses. Ours was a aloof and never asked to refill my coffee. That is a first. Service here is usually excellent. And no, it was not busy at all.  I ordered the steak and eggs. My daughter had the waffles. My son had a basic egg and bacon breakfast. Everything we usually order when we visit.   The steak was absolute rubber...throw in the slimy fat and it was just horrible. Country potatoes were like pebbles. Biscuit was dry. My daughter said the waffles tasted different...lacking that buttermilk fluff with slight crisp taste. My son barely ate his food just because he is difficult like that...but he always eats the bacon. Not this time.  He said it was too salty and soft. I tried a piece and it was.  We usually leave here very satisfied but this visit left me disappointed and hungry. New cooks? Lower quality of food? New management? Who knows!

Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States

EADn0djMtRAU9YBmmat_3g.text: Your basic breakfast in a fine but not breakfast-y atmosphere.  Good basic food.  The biscuit was light & fluffy.  The service was kind & helpful.  A solid breakfast choice in Cotswold area.

H6lBAKZCyPUWh9JARAOfRA.text: Haven't been in way too long. Gotta love the she crab and gouda mac n cheese.  Johnathon was a superb server...

YsQFydX6uIV_EZHY3TLxZA.text: Ya can't beat this place for a great brunch, solid Bloody Marie's, excellent service and interesting menu. Weekend go to.

AkeqC1rM7buXVPphbZErGA.text: Woke up this morning (more noonish really) in hopes of getting a good breakfast nearby. My boyfriend and best friend were both ready to eat here. We were excited and hungry, considering she had been in the past and said the food was very good. We walk up and see people sitting outside, not surprised there was a wait on a Saturday morning. It was busy and very hot outside, but we put our name in at the front stand. There was a young man that stood beside an older bald one and they were taking names and giving wait times. The man was very short and rude as my boyfriend asked if we could give our phone number so we could wait in the car, the seats outside were full and everyone was sweating because it's 108 degrees. The guy is giving us attitude and acting like we're asking him to take off his right hand or something,  but he takes our number and says "ok". I didn't like the way he treated us considering we were first time customers, but the reason I was driven to write this review was because as were walking out the front door the man makes a smart ass very rude remark about my boyfriend and and soon as the door shut behind me, I decided we were not coming back. I work as a waitress and I know people are frustrating but if you want customers and a good reputation then clearly you have to learn good customer service and to bite your tongue, very disappointed.

SGS5QkCL8T6fUaJ_PbKDhA.text: 3.5: I came to Eddie's this past Sunday for breakfast because I needed a break from my typical breakfast spots (Toast/Flying Biscuit). I saw a lot of Yelpers check Eddie's out so I thought I would give it a try.My husband and I arrived around 10am on Sunday and had a 25-30 minute wait. No biggie. Once we were seated we were greeted right away. I started with a water and coffee. Aside from their daily menu, they also had 3 breakfast specials for the day. I'm not sure if they rotate them weekly, but they did look good.  I decided to go with the breakfast burrito with chicken - $8.95. Instead of getting the rice and beans (which it comes with) I was able to substitute them for the hashbrowns and no additional uncharge. My husband got the chicken and waffles. Service was fast and they were continuously filling my coffee and water. Our food came out fast and hot. The breakfast burrito was good- served with salsa and sour cream, but the outside of the shell was pretty dry. I still throughly enjoyed it and the hashbrowns were yummy. My husband's chicken and waffles were very good, but we noticed the breading on the chicken fell off easily so it made it hard to eat.  Overall, we had a good experience and the prices were a good value ($7-$10 per plate). I would be back, but I would try an omelet next time. Their 3-egg omelets come with unlimited toppings, a side and a biscuit for only $8.95... pretty good deal in my eyes. The burrito was nothing to leave me wanting more....   I also noticed from browsing their dinner menu that they are Cajun inspired. I will have to come back for dinner and get the Cajun pasta! It sounded delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Breakfast burrito, $8.95. You can substitute the rice and beans for any side. I got the hashbrowns.

1TvllwxwZgO1jupMVeUbYA.text: Our favorite spot for weekend breakfast!! Everything is always great tasting and we love all the staff- they know my daughter and what she orders every week!! Dinner and lunch menu items are just as good- but I'm sorry it's always amazing when you can get breakfast all day long!!

IRRYLYmfMHbpFL3ZONyHnA.text: I found this place on Yelp reviews.  We are not at all familiar with the Charlotte area and we were looking for a non-chain breakfast place to meet up with our son who was driving up from South Carolina.  This place did not disappointment.  The food was delicious and had a flare that was different from your traditional diner breakfast fare.  For example, their french toast is prepared with Ciabatta bread as opposed to regular white bread.  One of my son's ordered the chicken and waffles and the portion was huge - in addition, you get to pick a side.  The portions were generous, the quality was delish and the price was reasonable.  Most important our server was attentive even though the place was busy with a line out the door.  Our food was served promptly and we didn't feel rushed to leave our table.  Will definitely use this as a regular meeting point in Charlotte.    PS. - if you are up late at night - they are open until 2pm and still serving a limited food menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Brunch specials

iN1fVto47U12qys3Fd6XEw.text: REVIEW SOLEY BASED ON PICK UP: You would have to pay me to eat here. Mediocre food. First of all, corn beef hash in a can taste 10xs better than what they serve. My "old fashion hash browns" had store bought cheap cheese on top, how do I know? Cause I can see the squares of the Kraft cheese (bet it's not even kraft brand), guess not so old fashioned. Nachos are a miss for sure. AGAIN STORE BOUGHT salsa, definitely Tostitos brand. Red bean was bland. Only good review was tomaria and lettuce on nachos were good.

Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Store bought square cheese on top
