sQD-WXVJoGvlcihhgcqLdw.text: I had a pretty standard breakfast and it was okay. Eggs, hash browns (fried potato cubes), ham and a lot of great rye toast. It's three stars because they were too busy for the amount of staff. Sitting at the bar and facing the kitchen, I saw quite a few plates sitting up there ready to go to tables for way too long. Including my own that was up for a good four minutes.  When they had time, the service was friendly and good but they needed at least one more person working the line this morning.

photos.caption: Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Breakfast at Eddie&#39;s Place
Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Eddie&#39;s Place in Charlotte NC

X26SUv0lnGRzDNE5jWZdoA.text: If not for Yelp I wouldn't have known about this cozy gem. We arrived 7:30 pm on a Friday night and you know what? With the music playing and the tables full, you could still have a conversation without yelling! The staff was pleasant and attentive coming by often to check on us. I ordered the breakfast burrito with chicken. For my side I had red beans & rice. The burrito was cheesy with crunchy veges and at a great temperature. Nom nom! The red beans sadly, had no flavor. I'm not one to re-season food but I had to this time. My husband had fried chicken and biscuits and he was smiling the entire time he ate them. We'll certainly go back a second time. The atmosphere is easy and there is no real reason to dress for this place. Casual nights for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Quite the welcoming bar!
Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Try the breakfast burrito with chicken but getva different side than the beans &amp; rice though.
Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken and gravy biscuits are delish!

afDLkKI7fPy2LjRIeXVFQg.text: Love this place. It's locally owned. The fries are hand cut. They may be my favorite thing on the menu but then I would be forgetting about the She Crap Soup which is totally the best in Charlotte. They have a great breakfast selection and really good burgers too.

1xK_-0HcrgE04ZSF_4rrXw.text: I just drove like over 20 minutes to come here to find out they close at 10pm.  Like really this is probably the worst experience I probably could have had.  I'm probably not going to ever visit this place again based off this one experience.  I'm so glad that everyone else had a stellar experience and that's what I hoped to experience but that just wasn't in the cards.

l28M8Rvod6WF80XHAPseQA.text: The next stop on my Reuben adventure took me to Eddie's Place, somewhere I didn't even know existed until I found them on yelp searching for Reubens. The place was a decent spot and the service was good.   The Reuben was fairly average - standard ingredients well proportioned with a very good amount of tasty Swiss. But nothing else about the Reuben stood out - average corned beef, buttery rye bread, and sour kraut from a can (or bag). Which doesn't mean it's a bad reuben, just didn't stand out from the many others I've had around the city. Overall it was an enjoyable sandwich and I'd have no issue eating another, but it's not a place I'd plan a trip for specifically for a Reuben.

photos.caption: Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fairly average Reuben from Eddie&#39;s Place - no major complaints

K-5lR7gYktMwQUp2SxGfWg.text: Did a check in while I was there. But they def deserve a full review.   First time here. Absolutely loved it. I'm known for hardly eating my food. I always have to take a box to go. But not this time, I ate it all. It was a lunch portion but it was quite a bit of food. I got the chicken parm and it was so good. I also had their salad before my meal and that was good too.   Surprised I never saw this place or heard about it before. A fellow nurse brought me here on our way to South Park and I'm so glad she did.   The service was great and the restaurant decor was decent(causal dining). It was very cold inside(maybe because we were seated by the window) but other than that no complaints. The booth was pretty large.   Parked right out front. Food came out in about 15-20 minutes. Server came to check on us quite frequently until it was time to pay lol. He was very busy though. We went to the register to pay.   Def will go back. Next time I'll try something different. My friend got country fried something and grits I think. She wanted something else but they told her it was only served on special occasions or a certain day(not sure). However, she enjoyed what she ordered as well. Def would go back if I'm in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken parm was delish.
Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Menu.

3XhClnyxGIIFmGzfFuF6EA.text: Eddies is great for breakfast and very family friendly. We went tonight for prime rib night. I was surprised with how good their prime rib was for dinner. The horseradish sauce may be the best in town.

xN50USwCOL6_dhq8WYMqXA.text: Solid diner-style establishment. Great food, affordable prices, and a wait staff that has their act together. Couldn't ask for anything else.

MbdDhl1LxJxMp8GDcouJJg.text: I would describe the atmosphere was set up like a old timey sports bar (I guess). The service was great. My husband and I ordered breakfast which was ok if you don't care for flavor in your food. We noticed a lot seniors in the restaurant which might explain why there was no seasoning in the food.

Kr4O7Piie9MxLrw37V-JpQ.text: This is simple. Very good food. Good service. And you have to have the She Crab soup. You must. It has to be one of the very best I've had anywhere. And I've had some over the years. And while I don't really like Ranch dressing theirs is the best. Questions?

Gcqcf7-6ToVPjQ-YWe5ahQ.text: When you go to a restaurant, both the food *and* the service have to be excellent for one to recommend it and go back again. *In the case of Eddie's Place, the food was good and the service was lousy. I love how they have heaters outside the restaurant for those cool mornings like today. If it's a nice enough day, you can sit outside. Limited choice menu, especially for breakfast. Lots of al a carte choices. Once I got seated, it took a long time for me to get my drink ordered. Big NoNo for most people. When he finally poured my first refill, he spilled coffee so that it got all over the cup and pooled around it ba I had to snag my server as he took the order of two people who were seated after me to get him to take my order. He said he thought I was waiting for someone, even though I didn't tell anyone that. He assumed and did not asked. Another Big NoNo. I had to snag him again to get refills on my coffee. He started clearing the table before I was even ready to go. Overall, I would recommend this place during the week when it's not busy.

photos.caption: Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States

rmzyxh1Kl8epLCghYguI8Q.text: Alright, I know this place is a local legend. I want to give it a higher rating, I really do. But Eddie's place was a big "meh" in my book.  First of all, it's trying to accomplish wayyyyy to much. Is it a southern comfort place? A breakfast place? Eclectic American? Bar food? Deli? And why the shit are there potstickers on the menu?  As for the food, I ordered the shrimp and cheese grits, which were very good. Possibly the mildest grits I'd ever had. It came with a salad that was substantial and included bacon. So far, so good. Some friends ordered the she-crab soup, which was tasty, especially with a bit of sherry.  However, a friend ordered the potato skins, which were completely lacking for flavor. Couldn't taste cheese, potato, or even sour cream. Just grease and carbs. Another friend ordered the reuben. It did not look good: greasy, with far too little meat.  The service was friendly, but bumbling. First, the potato skins came out as potstickers. Strike one. Then they added $1.50 to my tab because I asked for spinach in my salad. Seriously? First of all, spinach is not that fucking expensive. And secondly, you couldn't even put that in the fucking menu? Or explain to me that it cost extra? I call bullshit. Bullshit x1000.  Prices were high for the food they were serving. Needed to be about 20% less.  The place loaded up with people as we finished our meal, so we got out of there quickly to make way for the next party. I wanted to shake some of them on the way out and shout, "Why are you wasting your money here?! Go someplace where you can get consistent food with competent waitstaff!"  So, I dunno. Not my cup of tea. Maybe if you can stand dumb servers and you can distinguish between what is good and what isn't on the menu, you'll have a better time.

oft4FAZfLaV3GQHNreDK-g.text: Muffletta. I stopped by last night to do some shopping in the area and ordered the Muffletta with fries, it was sooo good! My waiter was insanely friendly and helpful and the peach cobbler for dessert was amazing! It's a great little spot, it was busy because it was a Friday night, but not overly so. My food came out quickly and fresh and hot. I will be coming back for more!

-gvuX3E3WL2pZP6V0OYhnw.text: Fantastic red beans and rice and my wife loved the shrimp and grits. Great prices. Very reasonable and clean. We will be back.

oJSkFRXm1YkYCA74tRnb2w.text: Came by here after work for a few beers, stayed for more than a few and enjoyed fried pickles and onion rings for the first time...the fried pickles that is.  It is a very nice spot - on an Wednesday night, it was an older crowd but worked out great because I came to talk bizniz and it wasn't all crazy or nothing.  The bartender/waitress were friendly and checked on us a few times.  I hadn't been to a True local bar, so it was my first time in one in Charlotte.  Everything about it was quite nice without anything overly awesome nor anything near bad at all.  Had fried pickles for the first time, didn't think they were particularly awesome, but went well with beer.  The onion rings however were perfect - enough onion to know you're eating it and the fried portion was simply splendid.  It stayed on the ring, wasn't too soft or brittle.  Definitely will want to make it out here again sometime soon.  dmo out.

NA5AtuNtqBQyrZLhb9n7Zw.text: My son and I went there for a late breakfast the Wednesday before Christmas. The restaurant was crowded and bustling, but there were tables available. We were seated immediately, and a waiter was there to take our drink order within minutes. The eggs were over medium, as requested. The bacon was crispy, and the grilled biscuit was perfect. The staff is even attentive with refills on the coffee. As usual with Eddie's, it was a good experience.

yB7RTwFdDvmH1WypoT7DQA.text: Had a friend take me here for brunch and you can tell it's a neighborhood favorite, be prepared to wait! We managed to get a seat at the bar after about 5 min and had good service and I enjoy the 'cheers' feel to the place. I had an egg sandwich and mimosa for brunch. Food took forever! Not sure if just backed up or if that's usual. And brunch wasn't bad, but nothing above average. But I plan to go again to try other items on the menu!

z-vsnuUJ5ZIexv4MjM7LuA.text: The food is always very good, but the restaurant itself is really in need of a re-do.  The kitchen/bar/bathroom areas are really dirty and the recent lighting changes are far too bright.

e4ZItswhpOWRPiPsVNbYBA.text: I will suggest the parmesean cheese grits.. Its not.on the menu but it will BLOW YOUR MIND... as will everything else on the menu.. A Charlottean classic.

sLKUNdDL6isLZTrxnEQ2YA.text: Very friendly staff and great service! The food was also good. I had the chicken and waffles and the chicken was pecan breaded which added something special to the dish. The biscuits were also a favorite. The only negative was the coffee wasn't very good and we are huge coffee people, so that was a little disappointing.

iFojCIQefoM0irleHBgQQg.text: After sitting outside waiting patiently for a half hour and watching a slew of people who arrived far after us get seated, we asked how much longer for our party of two.  The hostess was extremely rude and unapologetic about skipping over us.  We left without even eating.  I don't care how good your food is if you have service that bad.

IA0-D72AzLievHM6R2dN9w.text: Mid-morning get together.... Lunch was starting to be served but I wanted a breakfast.... No Problem.... Comfort food every day and they are glad to see you....nice place to be  PS the food is great too!

gnRSXsi_qQcLdTVd0-uW2w.text: Waking up on a Sunday morning with not a whole lot of nothing to do produces one result: late breakfast. Oh, what a joy it is to be starvacious in the morning hours and to fire up a Yelp search on the old iPhone and up pops Eddie's. A a breakfastular force to be reckoned with. Rumblin' tummies beware. Your hunger won't plague citizens for long!  It's a quaint spot on Sharon Amity with humble outdoor seating, bar seating, booths and tables inside. No cockamamie and kitschy decorations either. Just plain old diner fare.   Seated quickly. Every table was packed, but we managed to score a booth only after 10 minutes. Not too shabby.   The Southern Scramble is a deep-fried force of culinary nature. Two large chicken breasts, fried, atop crispy biscuits and a smattering salty, porky, and thick gravy. Throw in a handful of handcut fries and the morning just turned into a snooze fest. Such an incredible meal. I felt like I was hit with a tranq dart afterward. My wife had the french toast. Thick cut and packed with spices. Amazing.   You could say I'm a fan. I'll definitely be back for breakfast on weekend mornings that can only be spent at a booth, snarfing on a Southern Scramble. Viva Eddie's!

qKdsFvvMkBkrHKWMIcuOZg.text: 2e recently moved to Charlotte and were in the area. I trusted Yelp and it was just as great as the reviews were. We had breakfast. I had the Waffle Breakfast! What ever you do say Yes to the Apple Cinnamon Butter with it! It was so good. My bf had the steak and eggs! Steak was a tad bit dry but would try it again! Service was great and on top of things. Host even open the door for us on the way out. They also have a full bar. Can't wait to go back!

jqg1P8RD8U5PLwDXVKKkBA.text: Great food and great service. Jesse and Ben are two of the best servers/bartenders in Charlotte, they know the menu inside and out, are efficient, and have a pleasant demeanor. Ben always remembers my order even though I only visit once or twice a month. Sit at the bar for the best service. You know it's good service when there is a wait to sit at the bar for breakfast. Amazing cheese grits. A great place to go for breakfast but arrive early as there is always a wait on the weekends. Excellent prime rib special on Tuesdays as well.

JNuEi6Xl9QDrLocsvxkyLw.text: This place is delicious, but be prepared to be completely overlooked by the bartender if you're not a "regular." Waited for 10 minutes to get a seat at the bar only to have the bartender seat someone he knew who had just walked up.

YEbxhGpECw0Bnqt2pH6p8A.text: Great food.. Must try their weekly specials..  Grilled grouper dinner, ribs and beef stew have been my favs. Servers are sweet and charming. Nice chill out environment.

oq-wQ8kCn_xtwrYBNj5K9Q.text: Went here on a Sunday morning and parking is terrible. There were people waiting but turnover was quick. Selection was good but taste was mediocre maybe a bit more. Portions were good. I would eat here again in pinch but for a couple of dollars more Cafe Monte is a much better pick.

xERJjN_hZrnGOyPaUR5wGw.text: We moved into the Cotswold neighborhood in 2000 and tried Eddie's Place soon after.  Over the years we continued to hear how many people enjoyed Eddie's as an independently-owned neighborhood restaurant.  We didn't go back until a few months ago and now we are semi-regulars for Sunday breakfast.   The restaurant hasn't changed much but our perception of Eddie's Place has.  As more and more shopping centers prefer to attract chain restaurants and stores it is good to know that there are independents still able to survive and thrive.  Their breakfast specials add variety to their regular menu.  Eddie's is a great asset to the community.

WIP09wrZtrw6iYBNn7mOMQ.text: REALLY??  The brunch here is awful!  so basic that I can't even believe what they charge...  when you choose ham as your meat, you get 1/2 of a slice of ham??!??  JEEZE!!  I ordered scrambled eggs with cheese...  there was zero cheese in there so I got plain scrambled eggs, 1/2 piece of ham, dry toast and over ripe tomatoes for $9.00?    My friend had never been there before and was super pissed to get a $16 bill for the uber-salty country fried chicken with biscuits and sausage gravy.  He asked for extra gravy and was outraged when he found an additional charge for it on his bill.  I was actually embarrassed to have suggested Eddie's to him, and trust me...  I won't make that mistake again...  I simply won't be back.

8XHSW-zojUvIOne7E6pHrw.text: This is our go to place for brunch on the weekends. Food is always exceptional. Service is always a problem. Rude all the way around.... Such a shame that such a great atmosphere and such great food is paired with undesirable service. We try very hard to get past it but if management doesn't do something about this soon we will have to go elsewhere. Many of our friends feel the same way.....

DSSte6CoutvJfFo3VdcjLg.text: For my first visit, this place was great!  I had the waffle breakfast and it was served with a honey-cinnamon butter that's made on site. Very delicious and affordable!  The service was fantastic and everyone was very friendly.  This place has become my new spot for breakfast!

NJmUmgaQog6EhTHqBB38Jw.text: Pulled Pork Hash was tasty with large biscuit. Others at our table got Chicken and Waffles-large portion, good chicken-and Ciabatta French Toast. Tried every dish and no-brainer favorite was the French Toast. Side of Parmesan Grits was unique and very good, but $3 for 2 slices of fatty bacon was not worth it and is my only gripe.

ZYnXc_IJ1XolMJmJe4Wf1g.text: Came here for brunch with a few friends on a Saturday. They said the wait would be 45 mins to an hour. It ended up only being a half hour which was great. They seem to get people in and out pretty efficiently. Everyone I was with thoroughly enjoyed their meal from start to finish. I had a waffle with 2 eggs, and cheese grits and I loved it. 2 of my friends got the Country Breakfast and said it was the best breakfast they had in a long time. Will definitely frequent Eddie's from now on, even with a wait, the food is so worth it. Servers were all friendly and cleared plates throughout your meal since the tables can get a little bit crowded, but they were not overbearing to the point of it being annoying. Eddie's is my new go-to on weekends!

isATIoVnXDtiwGZNFdjJuw.text: Outstanding food and service.  Out server Jarrett was too notch.  My parents were in from IN and took great care of them.  Eddie's Place is there new favorite place to eat in Charlotte NC.  Nice work Guys!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Local Musician  &amp; Radio Talk Show Host on WSUR &#34;THE HIVE.&#34;

03VrLuDoq7SKzte05anmGg.text: Nice service.   We sat at the bar.   Drinks ordered and came immediately.  Food came out quick, gumbo is FANTASTIC. And they have "not your fathers" rootbeer.  Definitely a great stop for lunch.

3nFK-SDonbrKoxcIboiphA.text: Tried the she crab soup, pot stickers and Cajun chicken pasta. Pot stickers were average, they were what they were which was fine. The pasta was average, the chicken that accompanied it was slightly above average, not a ton of flavor on the sauce. The she crab soup stole the show, def will return to try the much raved about breakfast and take 2 bowls of soup to go.

WSLhDvIhNHw7D6H6rbj1lg.text: The food and service is great at Eddies Place!!! If you in the area this is a nice place to stop even if your on a budget.   I had the chicken and waffles with grits.  Everybody in my party had something different and loved their meals.  My server Kent was friendly and very helpful on the food choices.

photos.caption: Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. The food is very good and the cost was just as good!!!!

F8pzEQwN7zjMfj0gQsU-_g.text: Great neighborhood spot. Been here for years. Good food and a friendly staff. Good place for breakfast or lunch. Always busy and food is fresh.

XSTZVzG0qrrWgylrPZGDlw.text: Been wanting to try this little spot for a while & we finally made it a few weeks ago.  Won't be the last visit, that's for sure!  It was lunch time & they weren't very crowded (especially considering the area), but that turned out to be no indication of what to expect as I first thought.   The atmosphere is cool n local, with tons of photos,  memorabilia from schools, local sports teams & the like on the walls, and multiple large screens, each playing something different (no sound though).  The waiters/waitresses all have a very laid back, go-with-the-flow vibe about them which is great (laid back, but not lackadaisical).    The food was spot on, plentiful and tickled the taste buds.  And breakfast is always available! I ordered the turkey burger w/fries.  Loved it.  At first I was turned off by the appearance of a mass-produced pre-formed patty, but was a convert at first bite. Yum!  Toppings were plentiful and condiments were offered on the side, which I always love (I'm the world's pickiest picky person & like to control the amounts of mayo & such).  The fries were my only sticking point, but weren't awful by any stretch.  Just a little too oily & thick for my taste. The other half ordered a make-your-own omelet w/grits and toast.  Mmm mmm.  Sausage was cooked well and very flavorful, cheese was just gooey enough but not too much so, and the grits were the perfect consistency.  All-in-all Eddie's is a great little spot for any meal.  I do think they're a tad pricier than they should be for what they offer, but not so much so it prevents me from going back on a whim.  I already have a running list of things to try next time!

photos.caption: Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Exterior (obviously!) with &#39;sunroom&#39; area to the left.
Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Turkey burger.  Actual taste belies its just-average appearance.
Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Make-your-own omelet w/grits &amp; toast (breakfast avail anytime).

4rSeHVrno8BKQQc17NQPVw.text: I'm a fan - YAY!    With a nearby doctor's appointment looming that I was killing time waiting on, I decided to stop at Eddie's Place for a quick lunch.  And a quick lunch it was.  The specials board over the bar let me know that Chili Cheese Dogs were the Monday special for August.  Yes, please.  And since I am going to the doctor next, I will only have one.  My waiter was super fast, though at 2:30 on a Monday, there really wasn't much of a crowd, but all of the tables that were seated seemed to be his.  He zipped my water to me and in no time, I had a lovely chili cheese dog with a side of pasta salad before me.    The dog, I believe, was boiled, which isn't my favorite way, I prefer a snappy dog with a char on it, but it was good, good flavor.  The bun was a standard dog bun, fresh and warmed.  The chili was nothing special, but it just had a good flavor to it, and instead of chunks of cheese on the top that the chili never seems to melt and I end up with shredded cheese down the front of my shirt, the cheese was melted under the chili.  There was no part of this hot dog that screamed YES, THIS IS THE BEST HOT DOG EVER, but everything about it worked.  I inhaled it, along with my pasta salad that was big pieces of penne (?) with olives, red onions and other finely chopped veggies in an italian dressing.  I battled ordering another one, luckily my server appeared seconds after I was done with my check.  Final damage - $5.36 for a delicious chili cheese dog and flavorful pasta salad.  Please, sir, may I have another.  YUM!

photos.caption: Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chili cheese dog with pasta salad.

ZCEclhZ5YjyPCuO0qAuA4g.text: Wait was a bit long for Sunday lunch (~30 minutes for 4 people) and they don't take call ahead, fyi. But once we were seated, the food was really good - no one disliked anything they got. As others have pointed out the Gouda Bacon Mac & Cheese is truly very "watery" (almost like soup consistency) but still tasty. And you can change things out or add or substitute pretty much anything, so that's great too. Shrimp & Grits were awesome, the Reuben was good but really greasy and needed more sauerkraut, the Breakfast Burrito was good, and the burger was just very average. We did have to flag down the hostess at one point to get some refills on water because our server was MIA for a little while during the meal. We were there for brunch, but they have weeknight dinner specials on the board over the bar, and a lot of them sounded really good. Bottom line, as long as you're not in a hurry this is a great little local gem, and we'll definitely be back to sample more items on the menu.

EO16f5gZmJQkkIfedLe49Q.text: Eddie's Place is one of the few restaurants in Charlotte where you can find an early sit-down breakfast on Sundays.  The menu is average for breakfast, but sometimes you can catch an awesome special of the day.  My favorite has been the breakfast potato skins.  The eggs are on top of the tasty skins.  YUM!  The Cotswold Eddie's resembles a family-owned restaurant.  There's no theme and nothing chainish about it.  There are just tables and a counter with TVs.  In fact, it looks a little old or dated inside.    Sundays can usually get crazy there, so get there early (before the church crowd!) if you don't like waiting for a seat.  We've sat at the counter several times (to cut down waiting time) and gotten excellent service and quick drink refills, being so accessible to the servers there.

7IufSx_mRN-3_i1lZPhHoA.text: I've been coming here for over 10 years. I have never had a disappointing meal or experience here.   She-crab soup, bacon cheese fries and their whole breakfast menu are what I find myself ordering the most.

cCerAtTbMc5MT454MQsISg.text: I don't often give 5 stars as I am pretty hard to please according to my family but this place deserves it. The she crab soup is excellent with lots of crab per soup full. The salads are huge and breakfast is great. I'll keep coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States

T313dALCJF1KeMpaj06ptw.text: I had the pancakes, bacon and eggs. I didn't go too exotic but what I had was good. The bartender was excellent. It was very crowded. Not a bad place to stop into if you're in the area. It lacks a star because I wouldn't say it's anything super special.

QHw26YbpaYqiiAScbhsT5g.text: Went for Breakfast and had the French Toast! Any place that flies the American  Flag is ok by me.  coffee good as well as service............early AM is great!

Xy0N-812EcEflrgbXIB4gA.text: Love this place! First off, any place that serves breakfast all day every day is tops in my book. My fave breakfast dish is their french toast. The restaurant also does a great job on the hash browns. Eddie's serves a solid cup of coffee too. For late night, you can't beat their fried pickles. Next up, I want to try their eggs benedict.   I like that you can enjoy a good meal during the day and get a drink at night (or whenever!).  I often eat at Eddie's on weekday mornings after I've finished with an appointment. It's is a great place for locals. I feel more connected to the community each time I dine here. It's perfect for a short, casual meeting with one or two associates, to enjoy the company of a couple friends or family members, or to just catch a meal by yourself.  Service is excellent. Every time I go, I'm treated very well.

j3VpAKx0DJPCX0U7sRkRtg.text: This is one of my wife and I's favorite spots for date night. The prime rib is excellent.

2sXy-tv-9Isoo4C3tnDkoA.text: I have been going to Eddie's since 2006 when I was wondering what it was. Well I am glad I did. They have some of the best breakfast in Charlotte. I love most of the nightly specials they do. They get great desserts from a local bakery (forgot the name) I love how it is in a great location.  Parking can be kinda tricky with Leroy Fox next door though.

3l0AEInLbvl-N1yH712Bnw.text: Finally made it in for breakfast at about 11 on a Sunday morning. We had to wait about 20 minutes and there was some confusion with our table but we were promptly served once seated. This is a quintessential family joint, nothing fancy but simple and traditional American food. This is not a fancy Sunday brunch place, but sometimes just a breakfast is exactly what you need. I enjoyed a three egg omelet with feta, mushrooms, peppers, and onions, with hash browns and toast on the side. I liked that there wasn't a limit to ingredients for the choose-your-own omelet. My husband ordered the breakfast burrito with beef. He was initially disappointed that it wasn't that big (clearly he is used to giant burritos) but was very satisfied at the end of the meal and had eaten plenty. We were both impressed with the hash browns, they were nice and crispy on top but soft and well cooked underneath. We enjoyed our meal and it was exactly what we were looking for.

YRSSIUnkVPLxC3bqucIM2Q.text: A Cotswold classic! Eddie's place has a little bit of everything for everyone.  If you're looking for an amazing breakfast or brunch they have you covered.  Maybe lunch or dinner is your style, their classic menu will not disappoint.  Lastly, if you are a night owl. The bar is open till 2 AM as well!

PnitavmRH2-nT7fSLalmPQ.text: Everyone raves about this place and I can see why!! Ended up here for brunch with the family one Sunday. I can't believe I've lived 5 minutes down the street for almost a year and never been here! Well I'm kicking myself now... but now and i know and I'll be back... SOON!  My experience here was a really good one!  There are always people waiting outside of this place so I assumed there would be some kind of wait and there was... 30-45 minutes and we were seated in 40. The hostess was very nice and when I went to check on the wait time around 30 minutes she wasn't rude and was happy to tell me that our large booth to sit 5 was opening as we spoke and they'd be getting it ready for us shorty. Sometimes hostess aren't very nice when you come back to ask "how much longer"... however, this was not the case. In addition, our waiter was very nice and attentive. He refilled drinks before we could even ask, he gave us time to look over the menu, but not to much so he could get our order in quickly. Overall the staff definitely deserved thier 5 star rating.  As far as the food, which was phenomenal, I decided to try an array of items and then of course my family let me try a few bites of thiers, as they know I love to YELP and share the love when the food is great (and this was the case)! I went with a Gravy Biscuit, the Smoked Gouda & Bacon Mac & Cheese and an egg over hard. I know very random, but I wanted a little taste of everything. The egg was good and you always get two thumbs up in my book when it comes out exactly how you order it, as that doesn't always happen. The Gravy Biscuit was something to write home about! It almost seemed like the biscuit was cooked and then browned on each side (maybe in the frying pan?), which gave it a crisp crunch in each bite. The sausage gravy was delicious... enough flavor without it being a KICK of spice... perfect amount and size of sausage throughout... and the best part is that it was thicker and not that sissy gravy with water consistency that makes the bottom of your biscuit soggy.  YUM! Finally for my meal was the Mac & Cheese... I decided to save this for last because I had a bite at the beginning and it was definitely the best item I had! Not only do I like to save the best things for last, but it was the best "take home" item that I had and I knew if I didn't finish it, I'd be just as happy eating it tomorrow as I did today! It was perfectly creamy, not too thick and not too runny. There were some extra spices/flavor that I couldn't put my finger on and it was AMAZING! I need to go back and  have it a time or two more before I make the "this is one of my top 5 Macs"... but I have a feeling it's already made it's way there!  The extra food items I got to try included, the waffle and fresh toast. The waffle was good. Unfortunately, I'm not a HUGE waffle fan and if I'm being honest, I'd rather just go down to the Waffle House. All in all though, it was just as it should taste and was golden brown with just the right bounce. Now the Ciabatta Fresh Toast... WOW! I think I'm still drooling over that. Golden to perfection, slightly crispy around the edges and soft and fluffy throughout. After I tried it, it made perfect sense why 3 of the 5 of us got it! I almost regretted my discussion in food and know what I'm getting next time I go back!  I'm not sure about the more "lunch" type food, but if it's any caliber close to the breakfast/brunch, I'm sure it's on point! Same with the drinks. It says a lot when I come to a restaurant and solely want to talk about the food, but this place was so good perfectly concocted drinks would just be extra icing on the cake! Not to mention the price is great!  If you're looking for a new brunch spot or just hungry for food... THIS IS YOUR PLACE! Try it out next time you're in the Cotswold area of town!

photos.caption: Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Smoked Gouda &amp; Bacon Mac

zMJO4g2dZQAvnp8DV0_nWg.text: What a gem! I picked up my dry cleaning in this shopping center and I've heard of old friends talking about this place, but I called ahead and ordered a breakfast sandwich with turkey sausage, cheese, and egg on a biscuit and hash browns. They have those tasty shredded hash browns, too. This breakfast sandwich was huge, and it had two turkey sausage patties on it, I was very impressed.   The lady with the pink hair was very nice and helpful. I highly recommend this place if you're in the neighborhood for a quick bite.

photos.caption: Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States

Xfcp4O96vO0rLoxmoWFPWA.text: God this place is good. Hadn't had the breakfast here before. Perfect is the word I'm looking for. Cheese grits were mad cheesy, omelet was fluffy, and that toast is THICC!  I've had dinner and it is amazing as well- red beans and rice ftw!

dM_smd-2IaEU9L3DkrBUxQ.text: Went here on lunch with coworkers. Took so long for food to come out we didn't even get to eat, had to take it to go.   Shrimp and flounder po-boy was great though. The bread is amazing! I can eat it alone all day! Salad was very a bit sad looking. Gumbo was a tad too salty.

BlWkKqzIVpCXUEbd-hE2ZQ.text: I have always overlooked this place because it's not fancy on the outside and it's tucked away in the corner, but I will definitely be a repeat customer. I ordered lunch for pick up and they said 20 minutes, but it really only took 15. The place was packed when I went to pick up my food. It's a very casual place and cool inside.   I ordered the Cali turkey pita with pasta salad and my friend ordered a house salad with fried oysters and habanero ranch dressing. Both were full of toppings and goodies and both were filling. Great tasting too! I'd love to try other stuff on the menu and will be ordering here again. Forewarning: the parking lot is crazy because Leroy Fox shares the lot and they're both good places.

2dRZo06GvxnBFsX80p-2bg.text: My husband and I came here after reading good reviews on yelp and we will definitely be back! The prices were reasonable and the mimosas were very tasty! My husband ordered French toast and I ordered an omelet. We loved both!

t3mCJuJr_tqXavik8dz6vQ.text: Nice cozy little place to come eat. I got the 3 egg omelet with all veggies, a biscuit and sliced tomatoes. The food lacked seasoning but I really enjoyed the atmosphere and the concept of drinking at a bar and ordering breakfast lol. Staff was nice and working together.

photos.caption: Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. 3 egg omelet with veggies, sliced tomatoes and biscuit.
Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. 4 egg omelet with veggies, grits and biscuit.
Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Front of building

d0uRsYoPhlkKB0CT9LF_wg.text: Eddie's place is a great example of no-frills, good cooking here in Charlotte. On the weekends you can expect a wait, but it moves quickly and you'll be happy you waited.   On this trip, I finally decided to try their she crab soup that everyone raves about. This, for me, was good, but at the same time, with every bite I was fishing out a shell. This isn't my first time with crab, and I know their shells can be difficult to find and peel, but I honestly just wasn't expecting to have to dig out a chunk of shell or two with every bite. As my mother would say, at least you know it's real crab, but at $6 a cup, I wanted to enjoy it rather than work for it.   I also got the Ruben sandwich, which was very tasty. It was traditional Ruben with the fixings, and the balance in each bite was delicious. I went with the veggies as my side, and they were a miss. Way too big of cuts, and had a freezer bag taste to them. My husband always gets their muffelata, and that is a large sandwich (you only need the half) and it's very tasty! Their olive spread they put on their might be the best salty/sour/olive bite you can have.

1jDB02rnDYezFp2uyVK6VQ.text: My husband and I came here for brunch on abuts Saturday. We waited thirty minutes to be seated but were happy to stand under the electric heartens outdoors prior to being seated inside.   I ordered a mimosa because my husband had and his was mostly champagne with a splash of orange juice. I was a little saddened to see that mine had a more generous pour of orange juice, but I'm guessing a different bartender may have made my drink.   I had a bowl of the she-crab soup for the first time and wow!! So delicious, rich and creamy. I want more just thinking about it. I also ordered a make your own three egg omelette but was disappointed because I paid an upcharge to have avocado in it and it was served on top and had browned. I know how quickly avocado can brown, however paying $2 for a few slices I expect it to be in prime shape.   The omelette was fine and the bacon was alright too. A little undercooked maybe and maybe a bit more salty than usual, but served quickly and generous portions which tasted good.   My husband ordered the fried chicken and biscuits with sausage gravy. He devoured the whole meal and said it was excellent. I tried a bite and thought the chicken was cooked perfectly.   We will definitely be back! One star off for avocado omelette issues. Hopefully we go at a non-peak time for our next visit and these flaws will be fixed.

photos.caption: Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. A bowl of Eddie &#39;s She Crab Soup

fqGLKCHYGPnKZ57_XZ3CeA.text: My family and I tried this place for lunch. There was a small wait, which was totally worth it! I had the fried flounder po boy, my husband had the cheeseburger, and my son had the fried shrimp and everything was delicious! The wait staff was friendly and worked together to keep the customers happy. Next time we visit Charlotte we will be back!

f2TIaj9tf6ERlfCO5_3m2g.text: Eddies Place is a great go to place for dinner or lunch or Breakfast all day ! This is my second visit there and I was very pleased with everything I had! Started out with the She Crab Soup! Nice and had a lot of crab in it ! Then the Chicken Wings, spicy and good ! Then I ordered a Hot Muffuletta Sandwich ! It was great, stuffed with meats and wonderful olive tapenade ! But the absolute star of the whole evening were the Hashbrowns.  Possibly the best I have had in years !! Crispy and delicious ! I am dreaming about a double order next time ! Service was very good and friendly also !

n2VXy4jAsHsNji7EbbEYbA.text: This local joint is the best and closest thing one can find as a local diner in Charlotte. The food is quickly served, the value is good, and the service is friendly. Don't expect anything gourmet, but the food is still tasty. I mostly go on the weekends for brunch - $5 bloody mary's and $3? Mimosas. Be prepared to wait on the weekends, but turnover is fast and you can get a beverage at the bar while waiting.

aCM50CfNxOOref4PAe-eYw.text: The best she crab soup in town. The bread they serve with it and the sherry alongside is just amazing. The oyster po boy and Parmesan cheese grits are also tasty. Haven't had a bad experience here.

o5CvtudFm3r13H8n0JbKkw.text: Chicken and waffles are amazing! We also loved the cheesy grits. We definitely want to go back and try their dinner items!

EiugtcOnrQadZCUl2oGq0Q.text: I absolutely LOVE this place!! It's very "Home" feeling as the servers are all casual and seem to care how you're actually doing. There's ways a line out of the door, but they seem to cycle people in and out fast enough where you don't feel like you're waiting for an eternity. My favorite is the chicken and waffles with a side item choice of Parmesan grits. Omg! I didn't grow up eating grits but these are savory, creamy and pack a great cheesy flavor. The boneless pecan fried chicken breast pairs so well with the warm waffle and honey cinnamon butter. Go and get yours!

vbpuf3E7epeXxRHK6oKLXA.text: Wasn't as good as it was last Friday (under seasoned steak, would it kill you to salt and pepper a steak)but service is really good. Mac n cheese very disappointing. All you can taste is buttery noodles even though it is very cheesy and bacony lol. It's ok at least my dogs love mac n cheese.

PgNdMcxfrs1o8QLszyR7cw.text: Came on a Sunday around 3pm and there was no wait and very few people inside. For starters, we got the fried pickles which were the BEST fried pickles I have ever had. Honestly, I would go back just to get fried pickles and going to this restaurant is quite the drive for me. It was the perfect amount of crispy and the ranch was amazing!!   I got the chicken and waffles as the main dish with hash browns. The portions were huge and the butter was the best part! The hash browns were a little too crispy for me but the chicken and waffles were good! The chicken could have been seasoned a little more but I'm still a fan! I would definitely go back because I heard the grits were really good and of course for the pickles.

photos.caption: Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Game changer. Can I give a 5 star review just for the pickles

iV7KbQxOyK1m5irqH5WRVg.text: Classic diner staples done very well, presented in a locals-only vibe.   You won't find many weekend-trippers here. Somewhat off the beaten path, Eddie's is tucked away in a quaint, obscure strip mall/shopping complex in one of the nicest areas of CLT. It will be filled with great patrons that equally match the greatness of the staff. They want you to know that their only interest is serving up damn good food, that's both familiar and comfortable, in a laid back environment. This is your classic neighborhood grill.  You will find a lot of familiar things on the menu that are done really well. Their breakfast items are excellent. Everything taste as if it's been cooked the same way for 30+ years. You will notice that 90% of the photos for this place are their signature pecan-crusted chicken and waffles and that's not by accident. You're gonna want to try it. I recently got their version of a breakfast hash with a Southern emphasis (chopped potatoes with peppers and onions sauteed in garlic butter, with sausage gravy, fried chicken, topped with two eggs and a biscuit).   Make sure to bring your appetite because you will absolutely need it. Eddie's is no frills, but there is a simple-elegance with their food that you will appreciate. One final note on the food...do yourself a favor and get the gouda and bacon mac n' cheese.  Service and pricing: Eddie's is no stranger to great service, having been in the business for many years. Their pricing reflects this as well. They have dialed it in enough to offer awesome price-to-portion ratios, which includes alcohol as well ($3 OMB Copper for starters). The service was fast and friendly, with average wait time for food arrival. Two very well proportioned meals, two mimosas, one beer, and a side of their gouda bacon mac n' cheese was $30...I call that a win.   Just like any other place, I'm sure they lack in some areas and have their "off" days, but I have yet to see any shortcomings. If you're looking for a very solid brunch spot or just a casual spot for a really good sandwich, definitely give Eddie's Place a shot. For right now, I'm going with a True 4.25/5.

17Q5U2sAn8viiFaW9XIDqQ.text: This is a casual, classic charlotte restaurant that is consistently good!  They have breakfast all day, awesome specials during the week (umm prime rib Tuesdays), and salads that are so tasty and pretty that you actually want to finish the whole thing.  The dressings are homemade which is an added bonus.  My go-to is the Cobb salad.  Brunch here is really popular so expect to wait, but I promise ya it's worth it!  You can always get a drink at the bar while waiting.

Ci04WlMYvMJGxmHMrYtj3w.text: I regret not coming inn here sooner. I frequent the gallery next door. The food was amazing (especially the chicken & waffles) and the service was also. I'm excited to go back.

r6CMUOiJ8YQH85cUtgkx7g.text: It's a Charlotte favorite but it does have its problems, the staff can really be moody, got our food at quarter till closing,it was so so but what got us, is they guit servicing alcohol right at closing, we still had food, we were confused considered some of the staff set down to have a beer, so the bar tender was still serving but not to paying customers, so don't go to late

BsiWaZDmGZ6w1I0EqZXC2Q.text: I haven't dined in yet, but I ordered the She Crab Soup to go. I love She Crab so when I had a taste for it I did EXTENSIVE research on where I should go.  I googled and yelped "best She Crab soup charlotte, NC" and finally came to a series of reviews for Eddie's Place. Needless to say, I was sold. I ordered TWO bowls to go and drove 20 minutes to get them.  It is by far some of the best I have had in NC! (SC has some great ones of course) it was creamy with nice-sized chunks of crab meat and without a super fishy smell. Well worth the price and drive!  Side note: the staff was very welcoming and friendly!  You're welcome.

lhRS875b3_ELqHE_kvDVUw.text: I wish we could remember what we ordered. I just remember the food was delicious.   The reason why I can't remember anything is because there was a cockroach on the wall and when we pointed it out to our waiter he lied to us (trying to make us feel better probably) saying it was a june bug. At that moment it flew at all our heads and we all squealed. The waiter had the bus boy kill it.   Kinda ruined our first visit. But again, food was good. Not sure if we'll be back; esp. since the husband detests cockroaches. =

5gWSCbhPdPMReQsCs0Tulw.text: The country friend breakfast is borderline the best breakfast I've ever had..the eggs Benedict is a close second, you will leave full and happy! Service is always amazing, the place is always pretty busy so I try to go on slower days. However? I must say it's worth the wait!

iIMzntoNtHfqGMNksgEfsQ.text: Fabulous! That's all I can say, even for the one-time I've been to this restaurant. My sister insisted I go, knowing I'm a fan of BBQ, for the baby back rib special on Fridays. I was not disappointed. The ribs were perfectly, fall-off-the-bone, tender. The sauce was sweet with a little heat.   The kicker was the shrimp and grits! I entered not knowing what kind of restaurant it was, but when I learned about the all-day breakfast, I was torn between the ribs and shrimp and grits. My loving wife ordered the latter and gave me a taste. They were fantastic! Savory, tender shrimp, ham, just a flavor bonanza!  I cannot over-recommend this place! Definitely going here next time I'm back in Charlotte.

EBLwFl_J6i4091AFXib9yg.text: The worst prime rib I have ever had in my life. It was sent back twice still was raw. I usually never write any reviews ever although this is a public service message Don't eat the prime rib..

sBcoSHn182umuUV45m6jeQ.text: Just wish this place was bigger. The food is great, love the staff and the shecrab soup is a must.

l7KOFqQDcT805RECBWNwpQ.text: Ok. Checked out a new church and now tried a new place to eat. Wasn't impressed. First, coffee wasn't as bad as other places, but I Still can't find a cup that doesn't taste like piss water. Waitress very nice. Place crowded. It was very cute and cozy, figured the food would be outta this world. Nope. Here's my problem. I ordered the special of Shrimp and grits with Tasso gravy. I asked what Tasso was and was told its like a spicy ham. Ok. I like a little spice. This shit was hawt!! !!  I should've been told that!! I almost Sent it back but I didn't feel like being an asshole after church, so I ate it. It's strange to say, but there was too much  shrimp and I felt bad it went to waste. There wasn't nearly enough cheese grits, which were delicious, btw. The shrimp were nicely fried in what I think was cornmeal. They were fresh and plump, probably 36/40 or smaller. My biscuit was big and fluffy. My friend was trying to eat healthy. So her dumb ass ordered egg white, hash browns  and turkey sausage. Hash browns looked undercooked, turkey overlooked. Egg whites looked fluffy. Overall, it was ok. I've had better. Probably won't be back unless I'm in the area. Nothing stood out for me.  What I had was good, if it wasn't so fuckin hot!

This place can get hoppin' but the chicken and waffles are enough reason for 4 stars. As I try more stuff, maybe they will get five stars.

JQelTGH636iDEkAvmZyLjg.text: So travelling to charlotte from Michigan and wanted to try the famous chicken and waffle.  Tried Eddies and all I can say is wow.  The chicken was juicy, tender, just the right amount of batter.  The waffle was great and the grits, I felt like it was my first time eating grits.  Service was also great and very friendly.  Must visit.

X6nhvckmaldHak0ffuBazQ.text: Their breakfast is great, but dinner was only decent. Still worth a visit for sure. The seafood platter wasn't overly fried, but I had a lot of oysters with a good chunk of shell attached. The Parmesan grits were great! Nothing special.

3eDobjDYUdjV0G7AXzSebQ.text: Good burger and good onion rings.  nice sized bar. friendly staff.

Sbjpca-DwQZsFk7cIzsHng.text: We have only ever been here for breakfast, but it is always excellent!  The service is always attentive and friendly (Jesse is awesome, BTW) and the food is always delicious! We especially love their Home Fries.  Prices are reasonable, too.

pkkQrkWx7wmPhR0ED-soeg.text: Yes it's True, 4 stars for a diner!! Probably the best in town. Consistently delicious, good consistent service. Try the ribs. Off menu items available, just ask, they'll make it.

mYm2EmHy6R8VqNxOdejUIA.text: Eddie's Place was one of the first restaurants I visited when I first moved to Charlotte (From Louisiana) in 2003.  In less than one week I was back when invited by a small group of friends to eat here again.  Most of my friends have been surprised that I like this place (if it is a Sports Bar PLEASE do NOT tell me) and more surprised what I order.    Though I have had a Soft Shell Crab Dish and She Crab Soup, I usually order the same dishes every time: Pancakes, Gumbo (Chicken and Sausage) and Hash Browns, Extra Hash Browns and Hash Browns on top!!!  These are my favorite Hash Browns: Cubed Potatoes fried on a griddle (I think) with a little Onion ahhhhhhh and if it were not on the table (it always is) I could forget to add a few drops of Tabasco Sauce.  When my server brought FOUR plates to my table (I was alone) the conversation at a nearby table suddenly switched from "Day Trading" to hiking the entire Appalachian Trail!  Eddie's Place has a comfortable feel like a Neighborhood Diner or Bar or Both!  Every time I'm there I notice the staff recognizes the regulars and are plenty friendly to everyone else.  Seems like all the staff put me at ease (no easy task) so it must be required that all potential employees be very friendly, have a calm demeanor, a laid-back attitude and still wait on ten tables at a time!  If you want to see my yelp rating for the food I had for Breakfast today:  Hash Browns with Extra Hash Browns and Hash Browns on Top, 5 yelp stars  Chicken and Sausage Gumbo (Big Bowl) 5 yelp stars  Big Biscuit very good close to 4 stars  Big Pancakes (I do not know what they are called on the menu) 4.5 stars  Gumbo for Breakfast???  I alsomost ordered Fried Pickles three times this morning!  Almost also did, I alsomost did not today!  Please keep it a Secret from me if this place is a Sports Bar, that would ruin it for me!

ECzllVBNsUBdLaYGbKvyYA.text: I just wasn't overly impressed with this place.  I searched high and low for a great brunch place and Eddie's Place consistently popped up on the various lists.  I like the fact that it is older and a little hole in the wall type place.  That makes me feel like it is authentic and bound to be yummy!    We were there for brunch...I ordered the eggs benedict...I know a safe choice.  My friend ordered an omlet with hashbrowns.  The bacon in her omlet was chewy, not crispy.  The eggs were overcooked.  The hashbrowns were old school style, which were honestly a little bland.  The service was just so-so.  I know we didn't get overly creative with our orders but I guess that is part of why I only give this restaurant 3 stars.  I didn't find the menu to be that innovative.  I was hoping to see some great brunch/lunch items that would be unique to this place only.  NOT so much!  They had french toast but with cream cheese but even their specials for the day were not-so-special.    I don't know...maybe I am missing something.  Let me know what I should try next time to really be impressed and I will update my review.

Ep7xqEIh7Y9-a7fqpwkvJw.text: Service was friendly, the cost was good, the atmosphere was eh, and the food was decent.  We had breakfast, a hamburger, and a Reuben.

yJ86hobXQ98pzQV3mDfCmw.text: I've been eating at this establishment for years - and I've never really had anything to write about. It's just your normal, run-of-the-mill, neighborhood restaurant/bar. Nothing fancy, nothing nasty - just...that place. Until we dined there for brunch last weekend.  I am taking away stars for service. Drives me crazy when a server walks away before I've finished ordering. I know they're crazy busy (and...quite frankly, a little understaffed), but interrupting me mid-sentence and then walking away before I'm done is...well - just rude. And someone should really train the hostesses that getting people seated is a priority, but double and triple seating their staff does nobody any good, and just creates the perfect storm of crazy for an already slammed server.  But, enough about that...let's talk about FOOD!! (My favorite!) Eddie's, as I've mentioned, has always been that mediocre place. The last place we think of for dinner. Lately, however, things have shifted. The food isn't so mediocre anymore. In fact, they've got some parmesan cheese grits that I might have an addiction to. They really seemed to have stepped up the quality. They've added variety, flavor and...seems like, freshness.   I'm impressed Eddies! We will be stopping by for dinner soon. And...you know what? I'm looking forward to it. Love it when great things happen in my hood!

R1ocuLGFDA-WEPBV0Qf6Ng.text: From when you come in the restaurant you fell at home , the presentation and to taste to your pallet He is going to be in "Awe"

-5r7eSzzvi3DrpN_8itH3w.text: The perfect no frills dinner feel. Where the food speaks for itself. Ben was a great bartender who knew the regulars and made the first comers experience nothing less than extraordinary.   We ate the pancakes (two is MORE than enough) cheesy grits and the Ciabatta bread French toast. We will be back.

-rOSpKm42cvDs3YA21Lp_A.text: I hate that this experience wasn't as great of some of my others but I will not based my review simply off this one time. I had great service in the past, good chicken and waffles and my family members and friends enjoyed it. This time the waiter was very.... silent.... to say the least.   Upon walking in one guy greeted us but then was immediately interrupted by another (to whom ended up being our waiter) . He interrupted him greeting us to tell him how there were no clean tables. Both gentlemen left the host stand and begin cleaning tables. Neither one said excuse me or we'll be right with you . I think the first guy was just as caught off guard as we were . We stood there just a little confused like "what just happened?" That's when another man came over, greeted us and got menus to seat us. The man who did seat us gave us some suggestions and welcomed us . Our waiter took our orders, brought our food and that was pretty much the last we talked to him. When he brought our food he sat a bottle on the table close to my friend who ordered the chicken and waffles . I asked "is that syrup?" We had no idea. She poured it on her food and she's like "no, I'm not sure what this is." Eventually the guy who sat us came back over and we asked about this strange bottle. He tells us that it's was Cheer Wine for my "She Crab Soup." It was just odd that our waiter didn't tell us what it was and it was placed beside her chicken and waffles so we had no idea it was for my meal. My friend really enjoyed her chicken and waffles , it was her first time ever having it as a meal.  Overall, I'll come back. I was just a little disappointed with the service this time.

Zgx4EiYAc59B0TtFaNu77g.text: Review update: My mom really likes this place and so I told her we could come back and try it again. This time around I had good service. The waitress that waited on us was really nice. It seemed like she had been working there awhile and had a nice flow going.   They didn't have the lunch specials yet because we came in a half an hour too early, but I noticed today's special was spaghetti and meatballs, which I would be curious to try next time.   I had the she crab soup and egg sandwich. They were both good. My mom loved her steak and eggs. We shared the pound cake which comes with ice cream and whipped cream and is served warm.   This place is good. I hope the service isn't again like it had been a few times in the past. They seem to have a great team going now and hopefully the other was just a fluke.   I will come back to try the spaghetti!! And maybe one of the lobster dinner nights, if I can catch it. I always seem to miss out on it.   This restaurant cares a lot about its customers and you can tell that in the staff that has been with them the longest.

Tonight I specially went to cure my craving for a bacon cheddar cheeseburger and salad with blue cheese dressing.  Their dressings are made fresh in house .... sooooooo good. jihXFpmRSmQ_1mQPGzmBPQ.text: Charlotte agenda rated Eddies as one of the best brunch spots in town and boy were they right! Eddies is a simple restaurant that reminds you a lot of home and offers all the classics! I ordered the French toast which comes with a choice of meat and side. I did eggs and hash browns! All of that was only $7.95 and the french toast became my new favorite meal from there! Only thing I would change with my order is asking for the hash browns to be extra crispy. My friend ordered the eggs Benedict and said it was really good! Next time we're trying the waffles, everyone around us ordered them and they looked amazing! If you're looking for a simple brunch spot that offers delicious brunch food for cheap then this is the place to check out!

4jz48Li7llVeJx2xI6jBNA.text: Go for the she crab soup, that is all I have to say!   They do have other good food options, but this is the best.  And they will usually have a wait in the evenings, so be prepared. Not a lot of space to wait either, but you can grab one of their variety of beers on tap while you wait!

Wf2Cu-XB4PfzY3dRe5UJ4A.text: First Time Here. Food was pretty good but slow service  My wife had a appointment at Horizon Eye and I ended up going with here in case they had to dilate her eyes.  Fortunately they did not have to but while we were here, we decided to grab lunch at Eddie's.  Nice little neighborhood diner/restaurant/pub that is very comfortable.  Industrial decor inside but several nice TV's all tuned to the World Cup when we were there.  Service is not outstanding so needless to say, we got off to a slow start.  Menu is an interesting collection of Breakfast and heavy on Comfort Foods.   I had joking made a comment about tuna salad the day before and that thought had been running through her mind ever since. Needless to say, she order the Tuna Salad Plate and a Side of Onion Rings.  She always cringes when I mention hot dogs but I went ahead and ordered two dogs all they way, hold the slaw.  Slaw on Dogs is a NC thing and even though I was born here, I'll pass.  In other words, two chili dogs with a side of Fries.  She enjoyed her Tuna Salad and is happy for a while.  Dogs were a bit greasy because of the grease in the Chile and a bit flat on taste.  Fries were excellent.  Never did get a refill on our teas and at the end, we had to track down the server just to get our check.  Not bad for a first visit and will try again and try some other menu items and hopefully the service will be better.

Everyone is super friendly. I had Ben as my server and he is nothing short of amazing. I highly suggest this restaurant...

4ChvfO0JUPxkppDEaO-mfA.text: A couple good things.  A couple average things.  2 bad thing.  Let's start with the good. My meal was by the far the best and would make me come back.  Manhattan Clam Chowder was spicy, yet good.  My Creole with shrimp was fantastic.  5 stars.  The taste was perfect and the size was great.  They were very generous with the shrimp too !  Two people got burgers.  They were average burgers.  Which means they were good, however if you were wanting to go somewhere for just a burger this would not be the place.  The screw up though was the fries.  Over salty and just not good.  Some of the worst fries we have ever had.   I would come back for breakfast though!  And dinner--but recommend the entrees.

I did not enjoy the food here I came for breakfast I got the red white and blue special the pancakes were bland the syrup wasn't sweet the grits were bland and didn't taste home made taste like they were made with water no cream only thing good was the bacon I was dissatisfied

uTM9uoou72edEVGKlnGr7A.text: Me & James went here for Saturday brunch since he had visited here once before and liked it.  Very popular place and easy to see why with such a great selection of excellent food and great prices. It was a very relaxed vibe and seems like a neighborhood joint and draws a lot of locals.
