LsWUaaMRsdf-grorgluBRg.text: Found this place listed on Google and decided to give it a try as we were passing through Charlotte. It was great! Absolutely no complaints. We ordered the pot stickers, a shrimp po boy, creole over rice, and Mac and cheese. Our service was great and the mimosas were a nice touch to the meal. Would definitely recommend!

GsDb-Mum8WSmg4W4A5XviQ.text: Great food for a decent price and friendly staff. Home town feel and atmosphere. Is a must if in the Charlotte area. We had French toast and the country breakfast. Both were excellent!

lVeQ5DbmTBCmEIxeENCT_A.text: OH. MY. GOODNESS! Breakfast was fantastic. Quick. Friendly. Served exactly the way I ordered it. And tasted wonderful.  What can I say. Ordered 3 egg omelette and it was great, extra well done as I asked for. Hash browns cooked perfectly. Biscuit to die for. I live an hour away but sure hope to be back...and soon! Highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sitting at bar

fIIKoQgeAiwfNad1iuP5xQ.text: Cheese grits - excellent, pancakes - excellent, eggs - eggcellent.  Love this place, great location, friendly staff, solid greasy spoon eating.

xUkuoxpmco9sNgQg4PFSug.text: Ordered the chicken and waffles, overall they were amazing, only downside to eddies place was the wait time, took a while to get a seat, took even longer to get the food but what else do you expect on a Sunday morning...

photos.caption: Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken and waffles

FzxgQRXTr48IhHl72AFrVg.text: Just finished a delicious breakfast at 3pm Sunday. I ordered the omelette (as many toppings as you like) with cheddar cheese grits and a grilled biscuit (must try!).  My husband ordered the chicken and waffles with hasbrowns. I would order everything again except the cheese grits. Our $5 Bloody Mary and Mimosa were good. $32.00 total and Great service. I would recommend.

8Tub70hbBwoSPVwoMqFUuw.text: Good food great service!  Go to place for our family!  There are few good restaurants in Charlotte that are consistent.  This is the exception.

u3yvQOH9qXhgCnxCU7LTVg.text: I have been here a couple of times for breakfast and I think Eddie's has some solid breakfast food.  First off, I have to say that I love their bacon.  It's a little frustrating that you only get two slices in an order, but it's reasonably thick and has this amazing smoky flavor.  Still, it's totally worth getting if you like a smokier bacon taste.  The other day, I ordered a special from there of orange and cream pancakes.  Basically, the cakes were covered in marmalade and came with a creamy sauce drizzled over them.  The creamy sauce was delicious, but it would have been nice to get a little more on the cakes.  Still, I really enjoyed it.  My partner absolutely loves their cheese grits.  They have a wonderful cheese flavor and less creamy than some grits you can get here in the QC.  They are not overly salty, which he appreciates.  Finally, their coffee is better than a lot of places.  I assume they don't use Cadillac coffee, which I definitely appreciate.  Eddie's may not have an extensive menu, but they do have some great specials when you come in there.  They also don't have giant portions, but I always think the amount of food is just right.  It is reasonably priced for Charlotte and I always feel like I'm getting good quality food for the price.  One of these days, I will make here to try their dinner menu.    Service has always been pretty good as well.  Our food has always come out very quickly, which I definitely appreciate it.  Last time we came, our server was a little slow to get to us, but she more than made up for that later.  Overall, I can honestly say I'm a fan of Eddie's so far and I look forward to trying out their dinner menu sometime.

6HUkV2VIvcVfxZq5kgggLw.text: Coffee was decent. Friendly service and generous portions. Try the breakfast burrito. Keep up the good work! Will definitely go back if I'm in the area again. I was told that it's calmer after 2:00.

_dNqVyvVNqEvXm3xqa1Tjw.text: The she crab soup is absolutely amazing! Fantastic food and food came out fast. First time here and I will be here many more times. Can't wait to try more things they have to offer. Wanted to try the egg nog cake with ice cream but lunch had me stuffed. You will leave very happy with very well priced items and the food is superb and great service

NS7QyvD86okSj8NIf70yzQ.text: Went in today for the first time today with my boyfriend, we both LOVED our food! He got the she crab soup (second best only to our fave spot in Charleston--and he has tried many!) and the shrimp Poboy with Mac and cheese. Said it was a 10/10 meal! I got the California Pita with veggies and it was great! We are usually tough critics...

OHqEU_WftRTrPhDombj-Tw.text: Been back for the mac an cheese twice. Not so good. Very dry. Cmon Eddie! Get it back together

7DdPYiP2R9eKjOzoI8Ty1A.text: I have been going to this place on and off for years but have always forgotten to write a review.  Its an unassuming diner type place with great staff and a comfortable full service bar area.  It has a crowd for brunch on Sunday for sure and always an eclectic mix of people. There are many locals who frequent the place and its felt in the vibe of the place. You can go wrong with breakfast there but my favorites are the She Crab soup and if you are in the mood for healthy - the chicken salad platter is awesome.   Give it a try - its cheap, good and the service is always good.

wewOK8ZRQkrsdZdLrnvoRw.text: Finally found our diner. Breakfast is served all day and they have a fair number of fried seafood on the menu. My husband and I came here half crazed with hunger from hiking all day so naturally we ordered the saltiest greasiest thing on the menu. I had the country fried breakfast with hash browns. Now, I suggest looking at the photos of the country fried breakfast and preface this by saying I weigh a buck twenty. It was so good, I ate the whole dang thing! I usually have my meals cut in half but after the first bite gluttony won out. I suggest it hands down.

RTpbWpQP13dU24WlNfP0Iw.text: Everything was excellent here! Great customer service and amazing food. A winning combination in my opinion. My wife and I will definitely be back very soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Egg white omelette! Yum!

SAsR4ACLPfZphA-UIiBtsg.text: Sunday breakfast is my hands-down favorite meal of the week, and I generally feel like it's a pretty difficult meal to mess up.  Eddie's Place has proved me wrong!  We showed up around 8:45 on a Sunday morning, and there were only 5 or 6 tables full.  We were quickly seated... and then slowly waited on; it had gotten to the point where the fella was starting to count down the minutes til we walked out because no one had been by our table.  Yikes.  Finally, our waitress appeared.  I ordered a basic breakfast - two scrambled egg whites, bacon, hash browns and toast for $7.50 - and the fella ordered one of the specials - a pulled pork benedict with cheese grits and cornbread for $10.  The food came out quickly, and about halfway through our meal, we asked the other how the meal was.  Both of us replied with "just ok."  My bacon was charred, and my hash browns were bland and rubbery.  The toast and eggs were fine.  His grits were a cheesy stew with no grit consistency, and the eggs and corn bread were fine.  Oddly enough, the pulled pork was the worst part of the pulled pork benedict.  There just wasn't much taste or seasoning to anything we ate.  It had been probably 9 years since I'd visited Eddie's Place, and that was for lunch, but I had a much fonder memory of their food and service than what I actually experienced today.  Bummer.

M_1W4Yd1qm7f39MVqGPaXw.text: This is my favorite place for Sunday brunch in all of Charlotte (however I've only been to about 4 or 5 places).  It doesn't hurt that it's right across from St. Gabe's and is still serving breakfast food when the 12:30 mass lets out at 1:45.  The wait is reasonable, the service is quick, and the food is great.  I like my eggs scrambled dry, and they always get them right, while by comparison I often have been disappointed by other places.  My worse complaint is that one morning I needed to send my bagel back twice before it was toasted sufficiently.

UQHeadMVrM1SYB3tTTYPPQ.text: Decent breakfast spot, always packed.  I'm not sure we got the right thing off the menu since it didn't knock our socks off like other reviewers. There are places that can do even the basics really, really well and that is what I was hoping for here. We'll try again but at this point not a place I will frequent.

IU7f2Fvrbp-htnLwYFUYOg.text: I finally got to try Eddie's Place.  It's a lot less busy on a Sunday night for dinner.  So I'll keep that in mind for next time.  It's a bit dark in here with the red walls and this probably makes it feel smaller than it really is but the chairs and booths are confortable.    The menu has several options with a Louisiana flair but they also serve breakfast all day which is a plus.    I ordered the cajun pasta which came with a side salad.  The salad was a bit disappointing.  It was iceberg lettuce, 2 tomatoes, 2 big slices of carrot.  Iceberg lettuce is just a real turnoff to me.  There are better greens to make a good salad.  The saving point was the habanero ranch dressing which had a wonderful kick to it!  The Cajun pasta was good.  The chicken was nicely spiced and it also came with andouille sausage.  The bread that accompanied the meal tasted like it was homemade.   I think this experience is more of a 3.5 rating but I didn't think they were worth the 4 yet.  I definitely need to come back and try the breakfasts.  I hear they are the bomb here.

ANvze3neTtGQxOhe2fHNIg.text: Love this place. Garlic Parmesan grits are the bomb. Chicken and waffle is a must. Yumm.

3d60WviSU9hweKAbysLk2Q.text: Always the best of everything. Sit at the bar and ask for Jesse. Great guy and lots of good cheer. Fantastic cobbler and steak.

photos.caption: Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Eddie&#39;s always has a great dessert.

3DvNptHSwDJjixDGPzHr6w.text: Wonderful local place.  Great character .   Good daily specials.   Greek omelet special  the food is awesome !!  Breakfast all day!!   Great service !!

photos.caption: Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Greek omelet specials
Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Good morning weekend !!

D7tD_Is8Ty_0y3ErtgSCew.text: Eddies Place has the BEST burger in charlotte... the BEEEEEST. Its a great neighborhood joint... good food, good service and a great place for breakfast served any time of the day. Besides the burger they have excellent wings and the nachos are a must. For breakfast you cannot beat their french toast.

Q-myO_ZtDn6eNPkFFKT9ig.text: Gross food and horrible service. Waited 10 mins for a waitress to ask us what we want to drink. Nothing to eat if you're vegetarian, hell no if you're vegan. Not a single decent bite.

QndmEN0d8wLTygQ089nikw.text: I had a chance to try Eddie's Place when some co-workers decided to stop by for lunch recently.  I will say that I was not too excited about going here based on my one and only breakfast experience there some years ago.  Don't really remember anything being really bad with breakfast, but I was not blown away.  Anyway, lunch on this day was a completely different story.  First of all, I was really impressed with their menu and the variety of New Orleans inspired items.  The muffuletta was calling my name as it has always been one of my favorites.  The sandwich can be ordered hot or cold and is made with imported Genoa Salami, Mortadella, ham, Swiss cheese and Olive Salad on Ciabatta bread.  It also comes in two sizes huge and double huge based on me ordering the smaller size and seeing that it was still substantial.  I finished it all and the side of fries, but 2 people could split it easily, based on how highly stacked the sandwich comes.  There are many other good sandwich options on the menu along with many other entrees, and I will certainly be returning to Eddie's Place sooner rather than later.

QIB3say05DiRdRF99Pk5kA.text: Some of the best French Toast in town. Lots of other good breakfast food as well.  This was my first visit.

iWHsjuK0n8152N-TJMcSmg.text: This is, hands down, one of my favorite places to go in Charlotte for breakfast. Every time I have been here I have been beyond pleased about my experience. Food, service, atmosphere, prices are all outstanding. I would recommend this place to anyone.

V8P0Gp03me4L9E0BDyVenQ.text: Solid breakfast experience!  I picked up a breakfast sandwich and a coffee, both of which fully met my expectations   I'm always down with options, and I was able to select the confection which my sandwich was served on (I went with croissant) and the meat (summer sausage there).  The service staff was prompt, enabling you to integrate Eddie's Place into your mourning breakfast plans with minimal disruption.  Like I said, solid breakfast experience.

Sl5peaVZkwKppz9n4zG9aw.text: Met my daughter here for dinner last night. It was pretty crowded but we still were seated right away. We couldn't decide on dinner or breakfast. They serve breakfast all day (A real + in my book). My daughter went with the cheese burger and I fell back on my favorite, french toast. What can I say, I'm a sucker for breakfast. My daughter's cheese burger looked great and must have tasted better because she polished it off along with most of the fries (she'd kill me if she knew I was writing this). The french toast was perfect! 4 thick pieces of french bread, cooked just right, with a little powdered sugar on top along with grits (cheese) and crispy bacon. Yum! Oh and the hostess was in a good mood tonight:)

zLBJgPyCJ3vewfdEo-r-gA.text: As my daughter said..."this place is great!"  The atmosphere is cool. Relaxing. Service was good. Not over-the-top. Just "get the job done" kind of service.   It was our first visit to Eddie's Place. So maybe we got lucky. But everything about it was great. The food. The atmosphere (nice and casual).   The Blood Mary was perfect.  Food was really good...better than I expected.   I prefer locally-owned restaurants over chains, but it can be a crap-shoot.  The only thing missing was Eddie. Maybe we'll see him next time we visit.

TMBkQu4L2KRY6jDg__CpMg.text: I'm good with Eddie's - I got a spot in my heart for anyplace that does breakfast all day long (which ironically I've yet to try!).  And the She Crab Soup is all that and a bag of chips as they say.  [They still say that?]  Eaten here several times and it has been consistently reliable.  My only gripe here is that this location seems like it could use a refresh in the decor, the floors and wall are looking a little long in the tooth to where the vacuum and wipe-down ain't getting the job done.

p5IwB7Phg74XW3n6Vz1sjA.text: Great low key Cotswold neighborhood hangout that's been around since 1997.  I enjoy it mostly for breakfast but it's actually a New Orleans style restaurant.  I hear the burgers are great too!  Comfort food, reasonable prices, friendly service and neighborhood atmosphere...can't go wrong with that!  AND...locally owned and operated!!!  :)

mW7eyPpO26VumOn8pjyXBw.text: As I have stated before, I love breakfast! So we went over to Eddie's one Sunday afternoon and got a table almost immediately, which surprised me since they seemed busy.   I had the omelette special, which was shrimp and some goat cheese, and spinach, and I made it an egg-white omelette. It was very tasty, even with the lower fat swap-out.  I also had grits, which were excellent, and bacon, which was also great.  A $5 mimosa was also a nice treat.  The service was lacking, probably because it was so busy.  It is certainly a very dated, bordering on dingy establishment, so I wouldn't make this a first-date destination.  But overall, I enjoyed our dining experience, mostly because the food was so good.

dz_TjLyt3_ZhaiCJDykHtQ.text: This place is an old favorite - everything is good here! Great beer, breakfast any time, friend pickles are DANK, crab soup and gumbo is sweet too. I always get a tuna melt on wheat - they'll pretty much make anything you ask for. Staff is chill and friendly and great atmosphere

s9CR6T5oV-HtyXRyn9v-lg.text: Excellent turkey reuben and fries. Real fresh turkey and crispy french fries.

gCW01jWGHRGWpcdZFGK2DA.text: We had breakfast here recently and the Governor of North Carolina was eating there, which makes perfect sense: this place is just a good 'ol fashioned Charlotte-style breakfast joint. Nothing fancy, but great nonetheless.   Since it's not much to look at,  I was kinda surprised when I walked in on a Sunday to find Eddie's TOTALLY packed. Make note of that if you're coming here on a weekend.   As for the food itself, it was pretty good. Mostly offering standard breakfast options, Eddie's also has some more southern style foods like grits and biscuits n' gravy, both of which were ordered by my group and were deemed awesome. Great coffee and service, too.

vjskelWckgaqIJ3SjBnmew.text: After reading the reviews here and a few local papers claiming this as the #1 breakfast place, we decided to give it a shot. If this is the best Charlotte has to offer for breakfast out, we'll stay home.  They were very crowded, but we didn't have to wait long at all for our table. The waitress was attentive and friendly. I do agree with other reviewers who've said the decor could use some freshening but that's not a deal breaker for me.  What made us decide this is not a place we'd return to was the food itself. I ordered the chiabata french toast with bacon and grits, while he ordered the Italian Omelet Brunch Special (3 egg omelet with mushrooms, sausage, mozzarella cheese and tomato sauce) with hashbrown and cheese grits.   My bread was soggy in the middle, and the texture felt like the bread had soaked up too much egg and not been thoroughly cooked thru. The bacon was rubbery, and the grits were tasteless and seemed slightly undercooked.   His hash browns were soggy and greasy, while the omelet was watery and rather bland. His cheese grits suffered the same undercooked texture as my plain ones, and while they had an orangey color to them, had no cheese flavor at all.  We hold out hopes of finding a good breakfast place someday, but for us, Eddie's is just not it.

OcqEcgpnc7DcvrHpEp0PlA.text: Eddie's Place is as homely of a restaurant as you can try.  The no-frills Cotswold location has a wait staff with character and hearty food.  I'm pretty much sold on those points.  I've been a few times and I've had their Greek Cheese steak-it's like a gyro on steroids!  Filled with lamb and beef, this gyro is hard to bet.  I'm not a fan of the fries however-they were "chipped" fried potato pieces without much substance.  The other sides are worthwhile however.  The staff are an absolute riot-I got "jostled" by my waiter for my indecisiveness.  Still, its a laid-back atmosphere and it certainly appears that the staff enjoy their job.  Our server was out to check on us regularly and we felt much love.    I'm going back to Eddie's at some point. The menu has some interesting treats, like Cajun dishes and really down-home dishes that I haven't seen in restaurants.  The beverage selection is top-notch, he-llo!

ZPzX8cgfALJV39y-EjJO3w.text: It's my go-to brunch place on Sundays.  There is always a line but it moves fast and the servings are big.  My favorite are their specials that deal with french toast.  They make a pretty solid omelet as well.

P5bDRb7abWuZPg7XqDPxBw.text: Please, please, please put the seasoning back on the french fries!!!!  Love the grilled chicken sandwich, tuna melt, burgers.  But put seasoning on the fries.  .

2JDzR8__QNYSSaFXidi8Cg.text: I got an omelet here and there was so much butter it was glossy. I didn't know I had to request 'no butter' for an egg omelet....  Over all it's decent. For a much better breakfast I suggest Original Pancake House or IHOP.   The service is also pretty crappy, especially if it's crowded.

c0mJlOZkAC1mlb70fAJaqA.text: Liver Mush!  Yum Yum. Southern Caviar!  I come all the way from Atlanta to eat real southern at Eddies

q0ehcICXWwobe6M20ykpxQ.text: Average from start to finish. Nice people and a well know local establishment. Food is simply ok and ambiance is severely lacking.

RMf6b6-OQzPEUPHnKaZG2Q.text: My friend and I came here for dinner on a Friday nigh after seeing the reviews on Yelp. She was particularly excited about the all day breakfast/brunch. There was no wait to be seated at around 6pm.   We ordered the creamy cajun pasta and their famous French toast. The Cajun pasta was ok, but the French toast was the best I've ever had. I would definitely come back just for those.

photos.caption: Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. French toast with hash browns and sausage patties
Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Creamy Cajun pasta

wx8zRHPxKyLTjm6aJdT_KQ.text: Solid breakfast spot! The service was quick and efficient! I got the corned beef eggs and hash. The corned beef hash was more like hash browns with corned beef thrown in, it was good but not a favorite by any means. I'm giving them four stars mostly because I couldn't stop eating my breakfast partner's chicken and biscuits. Ummm wow, something I would never think to order, but it was effing delicious. The chicken was seasoned well, the sausage gravy was awesome, and the biscuit was really the perfect icing on the cake so to speak. If I went back I would order that and plan not to eat for the rest of the day!

photos.caption: Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Corned Beef Hash

_xFLRoIx-1NgfvcT8NEmKQ.text: A family favorite ! Every time my parents come in town we always go to Eddies !  My dad and husband love the she crab soup and Cobb salad. My mom and I love the shrimp and grits ... and you can never go wrong with their daily specials ! Always a great meal !

pPGXT2XSN3rXMz_JHW5brQ.text: First time ever, the ambiance is chill and casual.  I ordered the Pecan Crusted Chicken and Waffles with a side of Bacon Gouda Mac 'n Cheese. The best in the Queen City!!!  The waiter was attentive and gave great suggestions for a Eddie's Place newbie. Oh don't forget the Mimosa special on Sunday (pictured in the background)

photos.caption: Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Carrot Pound Cake with awesome Salted caramel ice cream!
Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. February&#39;s Specials
Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Prime Rib (10oz shown), great deal for Tuesday&#39;s specials!

YQce23BvAmtoVdxkl40YPw.text: First timer here!! A small group came for a Christmas gift exchange during lunch hours and the place was packed, but service was still very good. Points for that! I love that they offered a breakfast/brunch menu and the regular lunch menu...I like options people! I got the country fried breakfast, which is fried chicken on top of biscuits, smothered in country gravy with 2 eggs...yes. Yes it was as good as it sounds. Next time I'll ask for extra gravy! NOM. The chicken was cooked well, and was not dry (which is difficult), and I got a side of cheese grits that were pretty orange colored...so that was strange but they were fantastic and yes, I ate it all. ALL OF IT. Also got a cup of coffee, and it was good...nothing fantastic but it hit the spot. Other people in our group got the chicken and waffles and I am pretty sure I'm going to have to order that next time. It was HUGE. Also...after my 3rd time around the front parking lot, I discovered there is a back lot to park in (I don't frequent this area enough!).

C69gTJnj7XVW0QxBinVjtA.text: I've been here twice.  The first time I enjoyed myself, it was brunch and I had the very good french toast and a side of bacon.  Service was not bad, but didn't make an impression.  Fast forward to earlier this week.  My girlfriend and I went for an early brunch (imagine my surprise and delight that the whole menu was available at 10 am!).  She had the vegetable pasta with a side salad - she enjoyed her meal.  I had the cobb salad with an awesome blue cheese dressing.  The True gem of the meal however was the service.  Ben, our waiter, was beyond awesome.  He was attentive w/o being cloying.  He was just the bomb.  They were clearly busy but he kept things moving and grooving.  He's a gem and made our dinning experience truly fantastic.

cWDPa_aqTtgIIXNGTeNmiQ.text: I absolutely love Eddie's Place any time of the day, week or year! Everything I've tried has been amazing. Today I tried the chicken and waffles and OMG.. it was all I thought it would be and more. The Parmesan Grits are my favorite side option. But there is something for everyone here.

photos.caption: Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States

Gl1OHZfO2T7IdkQPXKuKpQ.text: New. Brunch. Place. Excuse me while I do a little happy dance!!!  My friends and I stopped in for brunch after church on Sunday. The place was packed but we didn't have a wait. Score! Everyone here was nice, hostess greeted us, there was a waiter in BACON socks (does it get much better than that) and not to be outdone our waiter was awesome! He was very attentive and full of suggestions after we told him it was our first visit.   Everything on the menu sounded delish but I went with their Omelet...for one main reason: you can ADD as MANY toppings as you like!!!!   Whoa.   You can chose options on and off the menu to pile on your three egg yummy creation so I went crazy....I chose bacon, ham, spinach, jalapenos and feta.  Folks, that thing was delicious! It was prepared as I ordered, came out steaming HOT and add those hash browns and a biscuit ( yep. they are delish too) and plan to leave stuffed and happy.   Totally recommend this place! I can't wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. 3 Egg Omelet with hash browns and a biscuit!

enAUt54KflUOAB07xl5Ckg.text: Yes to an amazing Sunday Brunch!  Finally had a chance to experience Eddie Place. The food was Truely amazing. I ordered the Chicken and Waffles with hashbrowns. The chicken was cooked perfectly, juicy and not greasey. The cinnamon honey butter married the dish together. Everything was great. Service was good and the feel of the restaurant felt like home. Very good spot to try. I will have to make a trip back for dinner hours. ~Feliz comiendo~

photos.caption: Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken and Waffles with hashbrowns

4oHTdgOFfEbAzql-3KLviA.text: Very solid place! We went because my wife was craving soup and I had heard that their "she crab soup" was to die for. It did not disappoint! I highly recommend it. Otherwise, we had the lobster dinner special and it was decent. Our waitress/service was great as well. We'll be back. The burgers looked good too, I'll prolly try one of those next time!

2K1oTGINB2Ew8nt7eCpZ1w.text: One must try the she crab soup at Eddie's place. Coming from Boston, I think it's as heavenly as the best lobster bisque up north. The wait was long, but totally worth it.

gXcl6207z1R91CtziaE-0Q.text: She-Crab soup was really good. Nice amount of shredded crab.  Had a St. Patty's special of Corned Beef & Cabbage. Honestly the best I've ever had. Huge portion, and everything was just delicious.  Meat was incredibly tender and the cabbage was amazing.   All the servers were very friendly. Service was fast. It's a little on the pricey side, but I'm a fan.

photos.caption: Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. St. Patty&#39;s special. Corned Beef &amp; Cabbage. Incredible!

1oo3ZpqVsQwsbCw7AF6ioA.text: This place used to be pretty good. A casual neighborhood restaurant sort of place. But the last few times I've been there it's been pretty weak. I ordered a $6 blt about a month ago, and it came with massive bread and two wimpy pieces of bacon. And tonight I ordered a shrimp po boy (because they're usually very good) and they did not include lettuce or tomato or any of the normal sandwich stuff we asked for and that's listed on the menu for that sandwich. We called the store and the manager was not very helpful. Think we will be taking eddies off our restaurant list

photos.caption: Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Po boy. Where is the lettuce and tomato? And the tartar sauce?

m0hGRnWspECAU7rNjcVgQg.text: I'm in Charlotte visiting family and found Eddie's on yelp. Terrific lunch. I had a cup of gumbo and the lunch special chx enchiladas, both recommended by a very good bartender, who I forgot to get his name, but was really on top of his game. Food was delicious and the prices were very reasonable.  Btw I also took his recommendation for the blonde beer.  Just as good as everything else he suggested.  Great place. I live in NY now and am saying to you locals, don't take a place as good as this for grant  Came to Charlotte for a visit but unfortunately tragedy struck with the death of my father.  Eddie's was so convenient that I brought all of my family here over the last week. 7 meals in 7 days here.  All of them outstanding, and I've lived in NY for the last 30 years, so I know great food when I find it.   Breakfast burrito, all the po boys, chx salad sandwich, taco salad, she crab soup, gumbo, chx sandwich all got rave reviews from us. Time now to go back to our respective homes. My family jokingly said I became Eddies best customer in one week and that they'll miss me. But, you know, I'm going to miss them too

FSGzjReMu67YzWBqp6pKwg.text: This is a great local spot with a family atmosphere and the menu to back it up!  Let's start with their signature She-Crab Soup.  This is one of my favorite things to eat in Charlotte! It is absolutely delicious!  Even if you don't like soup...or crab, i guarantee you will like this. (Tip: put a little sprinkle of sherry in the bowl)   The rest of the menu is really solid with Sandwiches, burgers and signature dishes.  I usually go for the Turkey Pita if i want something light and pair it with a small bowl of She-Crab.  Also, they serve breakfast all day!  Tuesday night is $1.50 an ounce Prime Rib night (if you're feeling crazy ask them to deep fry it)

aXm4U7tZRs92xZIgXjnTBQ.text: On business and not up for the Concierge Lounge breakfast so looked around at Eddie's popped up.  Couldn't have been happier.  Nice fluffy omelette and great service to go with a kinda hip environment.  Prices were reasonable as well!

B4NdckEf7y5WkClqMz3-XA.text: The atmosphere was nice and had a neighborhood cafe feel. The bathroom was VERY clean. Service was good as well. We had the chicken and waffles. They were very good!! The pecan crusted chicken was delicious!! I also ordered the Parmesan grits and I was so surprised at how good they were! Please try them!

photos.caption: Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Turkey burgers with pepperjack cheese and a cup of shecrab soup
Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Turkey Burger with pepperjack cheese and shecrab soup

nTA-9KLLNQ1FxkcPYJdq9Q.text: It's a good little neighborhood place, but it is nothing special.  There is nothing wrong with it, and I'm sure if I lived in the area, I would go back frequently.  I went twice with family recently and I will say that they are consistent.  The food is good, not great but better than decent.  I will say that their portioning use a little work as that was not consistent between the two orders I ate (I got the same thing twice because I like that meal).  The service is efficient and what it needs to be.  The place can get pretty busy, and waits during the brunch hours can pretty much be expected.  But it is what it is, and it is good.  And that, is not a bad thing.

eKDj8OjUXjDJyLslfMu9Rg.text: Visiting from out of town and we ate here for brunch. Looks pretty simple as far as atmosphere and menu goes, but the food is delicious. Really surprising gem. One of my friends got the chicken and waffles- I think this is the brunch menu item to get! It was amazing. The pecan crust on the chicken paired perfectly with the waffles. All the food was delicious though. Cheap bloody marys too if that's your thing.

FERo-Ps03SXoDQyGG-WoAg.text: We heard really good things about Eddie's and some of the yelp reviews mirrored others sentiments. However we when got here this was not our experience.  We were sat promptly and this was good because it was starting to get crowded at the time that decided to stop in. They have a good selection of items of the menu. So we decided to order the following: A order of french toast, a side of turkey sausage, a side of pancakes and a side of hash browns.  The food came out quickly however just because it is quick does not make it good. I hate to complain now, because i did not complain at the restaurant. Here is what we thought of the food. The hash browns were under cooked and still very soft. Im used to a little crisp on my hash browns. The Pancakes were standard nothing really good or bad. The turkey sausage again was under cooked and very soft. It is hard to explain maybe its a texture thing? It was soft and cold just as the hash browns were. Finally the french toast didn't pair well with the ciabatta bread. It was soggy and not crisp.  I think that the place has a homey type of feel and a lot of regulars stop thru. I didnt too much like the food. It wasnt bad but it wasnt good either.

oDEYTDvMbdZCrQtqwFm-VA.text: Out of the gate they hit the ground running on my visit.  I sat at the bar on an early, rainy and chilly Saturday and was greeted promptly by Ben.  What a pro!  He's worked for Eddie since 2000 and couldn't have been more courteous and efficient.  That alone makes a 2nd visit a slam dunk.  Ben suggested the Greek omelet stuffed with chicken, olives, spinach, onions, and feta topped with homemade cucumber/dill sauce.  A side of cheese grits and pita tips completed the entree.  Very, very good.  Great location, urban vibe, neighborhood feel, and gut satisfying food makes Eddie's Place my kinda place.  They even use cloth napkins.  I'm in all the way!

photos.caption: Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Nice plug today on WBTV celebrating hot soup week.  Mmmmm.
Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Greek omelet with cheese grits.  Mmmm.

cJYP3hhEnwxQ6rLphFTeJw.text: Definite brunch/breakfast spot. Gotta try their chicken and waffles. Its to die for!

proR3t9JKYl4vfrjx_qaVw.text: Oh Eddies place, how I wish I could like you but unfortunately I just can't.   First, early in the day the line is slim to none to be seated, the hostesses are very sweet and so is the rest of the friendly staff. This is where my one star goes too.   Secondly, Prime Rib special.... Stay away from it. Extremely burnt, had no flavor and almost all of the rib was fatty. Needless to say I ate it all even though I wasn't a big fan and with my luck, got food poisoning.   Third, Prices aren't bad, beers are cheap and they do have good specials, my stomach just wasn't a fan of the Tuesday one. All in all, I could live my life without coming back here but kudos to the friendly staff!

uX4hx41jcQoZ0aoclGRuXw.text: Awesome food! The chicken and waffles were amazing! The waffle came with apple cinnamon butter and the chicken was pecan crusted. One of the dishes on special for that day was also delicious it was shrimp w/ sausage, roasted tomatoes, garlic potatoes, my boyfriend opted for poached eggs, it also came with a biscuit that was absolutely perfect for soaking up the sauce. It was a Sunday and there was a thirty minute wait but it was worth it.

DutExsfNxPu3ZFdp-Y5jVQ.text: Ok i frequent here for lunch and have been holding back. I am leaning towards they have new cooks because my chicken parmesan has been horrible when this used to be my favorite dish with this restaurant.  And sorry but not sorry I don't know this bartender name but he publicly digs up his nose like im not looking right at him smh.  He has done this multiple times while i have been waiting for my order. And just for the record he wasn't my waiter but he disgusts me every time i see him digging for gold

mzOaqcJFlf-eWo9WdX6JkQ.text: This is a great place for breakfast/brunch/lunch. Great southern food, very relaxed atmosphere.  Definitely try the cheese grits, they are amazing!

cEFDSJJt2gno_pLxYBKXCA.text: Too loud, apathetic service, and subpar food. I had heard great things about this place for brunch/breakfast, but decided to give it a go for dinner. The waitress got the order wrong (no problem, mistakes happen), then seemed annoyed when kindly asked to fix the problem. The Reuben was too salty, soggy, and barely had any meat in it. Call me picky, but I expect a sandwich to look robust and filling. My dining partner's fries were overcooked with blackened ends. If the food and service wasn't bad enough the place was extremely loud. Literally had to speak loudly to hear each other across the table. Skip this place and go somewhere else.

qIesBqYVrFwFCJSzHm70fQ.text: We have frequented Eddie's Place several times over the last couple of years living in the neighborhood and I'm just now reviewing! Shame on me!  Eddie's is a wonderful spot to come in when you're feeling lazy and don't want to cook, but you want to remain casual with no fuss. The menu is plentiful, there is always a daily special AND (super bonus) there is all day breakfast available. The portions are generous and I've never left hungry. The staff have always been extremely attentive and kind and the restaurant is always clean. It is definitely a neighborhood spot where they know several customers by name and life story but the staff never fails to be warm to first comers as well.   It's silly but one of or favorite things about Eddie's is how crisp the salads always are. Cold plates, chilled lettuce and fresh toppings, and the habanero ranch is an addiction of mine. For those who like to have vegetarian options like myself, don't fret, the red beans and rice dish is one of my favorites here (without any meat added) and they have a black bean burger as well (which you can add avocado on top for just $1 extra).   Overall Eddie's is the perfect neighborhood go to and we have utilized it many times as such. It gets an A in our book with no complaints!

Q9Sfj_BHbQIlBTA23LCPrw.text: I was in town and wanted to eat somewhere I couldn't back home. A friend looked this up and there we were. Must be a popular place. There was a waiting list, about 25-30 minutes. To jump ahead a bit, I'd say the wait was worth it.   I thought I had a large appetite. I ordered the pancakes and added pecans, cranberry, almonds....think that's it. Came with a choice of meat and a side. Had turkey sausage and hash browns. Also ordered a scramble egg white and Mac n cheese off the lunch menu. My friend had their special French toast as well as the chicken sausage soup to go.   I blame the night before but my appetite wasn't what I thought it was. I did taste around the plate. I thought the Gouda Mac n Cheese was going to be runny/"liquidy" at first glance. It turned out to be rich in flavor, and was par to my standards. Mac n cheese is always my make or break for an establishment.   I ended up taking the food with me back to VA. The Mac n cheese didn't make it past the NC state line. With everything I ordered, the bill was about $30 or so. There's already been a discussion about what will be ordered next time in town. I see why this place is packed.

photos.caption: Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. French toast. Taste as good as it looks
Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken sausage gumbo soup. Might&#39;ve fumbled the dish name. Wasn&#39;t mine.
Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pancakes, turkey sausage, scrambled egg whites, hash browns, gouda Mac n cheese. Powdered French toast off in the distance.

0G46uNKymh3TLWs0BJo3EQ.text: First time here, came for the Shea crab soup!! Cozy,  kid friendly and good specials!

photos.caption: Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States

40lEz9ANqLAxN8QjF_4p1w.text: I know I have already posted about my exceptional experiences at Eddie's,  but it cant hurt to give it another great review. I have been frequenting Eddie's place a bit more lately and I have to say once again, amazing food, great service as always, and just a comfortable environment, it's a place where everyone knows your name. Branched out on my selections from the menu, and of course, I was very pleased with my new selections and their specials. I can not stress enough how amazing the staff is. I visit many restaraunts but this place is my go to neighborhood spot.  I would recommend this place to anyone that enjoys a laid back diner with all day breakfast as well as a very wide variety of delicious meals, as well as good drink and food specials. Once again, i can not express enough that the servers, bartenders, cooks and management do an absolute amazing job.

9qcw3xq937ZVwfgkmzmyBg.text: While visiting friends of ours in Charlotte we found Eddies nearby and decided to give it a spin.  I agree with the 4.5 review average that they seem to be getting.  They are a straight up honest sandwich and breakfast place with friendly and quirky service.  We enjoyed our first visit and it absolutely earned a second.  My tuna salad exceeded my expectations and the Philly Cheesesteak was acceptable as well.  Wait staff was fast and attentive on both visits and I like local places even if they are small chains versus someplace like Panera.

3n4XmcekbBNGOrrxPh6KTg.text: Found this place on Yelp. Reviews were good thought I'd give it a shot. Plus the wait at midnight diner was ridiculous as usual. The cheese grits are delish and so is the biscuit. Basically coffee and breakfast was awesome and price was decent for the area. Totally coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States

6UBBYoUOidN-omGL1Rgouw.text: I have been to this place a lot for late night but this was the first morning I have made it for brunch. It is a very popular brunch spot and now i know why. we had to wait about 30-40 min but it was well worth it and we were able to drink mimosas/coffee/bloody mary's while we waited. i got the eggs Benedict and my boyfriend got the chicken and waffles - both were incredibly tasty and satisfying.  Although slammed, our waitress Michelle did everything she could to give us as much attention as possible while also juggling every other busy table. Her efforts were much appreciated! great place for anytime of the day.

photos.caption: Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States

F_l9o3GGPta9hYs6Qie6tg.text: Southern fried breakfast was good. Crispy chicken. Gravy was flavorful. Eggs over easy. They were cooked PERFECTLY! $5 mimosas with a good champagnes orange juice ratio. I will be back.

sT_vboyZBVh_VaDdv8TRmg.text: This place is ok as long as they are not busy. Seating is kind of clustered. Not ideal if you have a really small children. Food is OK, nothing to write home about. It's OK if you have nowhere else to go. Staff is friendly.

-T-XAXGtKXeA4OckHXkLgA.text: Fantastic food at a great price. Friendly staff, fast service, welcoming atmosphere. Eddies is a go-to for breakfast, lunch, dinner, take out, or drinks at the bar. You just can't go wrong!

DYv4-aVxl8PcUzwxygtkqg.text: Can you say scrum de li ish cious without drooling over yourself after eating the salmon over spinach salad lunch special today at Eddie's. .Answer:  Absolutely #NOT. .what a treat what a feat and did I also mention the simply tasty creamy cup of had to be homemade chicken and noodle soup also on the lunch special menu too..If every restaurant had these specials no one would bring their lunch or skip their lunch. .let's just say mmm mmm good!  Just one more thing ok you got me 2 more things..the waiter Jarrett asked me how I wanted my salmon cooked..excuse me come again after I lift my chin off of the table..No Way..some seafood restaurants don't even ask that & for salmon over a salad come on..Very Impressive not to mention the portion size..OMG..winner winner salmon dinner size!!  All under the careful watchful attentive personable & highly accommodating service of the one & only Jarrett

photos.caption: Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States

qGNDsHHmmc4GtfefOEczfQ.text: Chicken and waffles with hash brown. I think I'm in love, "who is Roscoe's" is what you'll be saying after you've finished your plate (yes you will eat it all) . If your visiting North Carolina this is a must. Great atmosphere and super friendly staff. Thank you guys

photos.caption: Photo of Eddie's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States

HYkkTL3Ofc_NvFpxMXl4fQ.text: Yum, yum, yum!! My favorite meal of the day is breakfast. It's a real treat to go out and get a big breakfast on Saturday morning. eddie's does breakfast right. Service is great and I haven't had anything here that isn't good. Their bloody marys are awesome! Ask for it extra spicy and you won't be disappointed. The blueberry pancakes are my favorite here. They're big and fluffy with lots of blueberries. Expect to wait a while if you come around 10am. There's most always a wait. But it's totally worth it!

0pr_orZwOISS6zvmLHGT2w.text: I'm a huge fan of Mom and Pop places. This one gets a solid 3.5 stars in my book. EXCELLENT and friendly service, homey atmosphere, lots of booths for seating, but the food was mediocre.  I felt a little out of place when I first walked in because this seems like a "locals-only" sort of establishment. Once the waitress came up with her super sunshiney attitude, my feelings were dismissed though.  Got the veggie burger with onion rings, things were cooked well but the only buns they had were made from white bread (super ick).  Methinks I'll try breakfast some time.

G9MumtwiyeAgIDiEXy8aTw.text: SO DELICIOUS!! and some of the BEST customer service from our waiter Ben. I would highly recommend this place for  breakfast!!

yI8aGSg4WB5VCfIrJxS21A.text: It's one of my best friend's 30th Birthday today and his favorite restaurant in Charlotte is Eddies. He was so excited to bring 5 of his best friends to eat at a place we had never been, and we were happy to stand outside and wait for a table even though it was chilly and rainy. The host, a tall skinny older man with glasses, took our name, and we waited outside, holding the door for every single patron that entered and exited for the next 30 minutes. At that time, we noticed that there were a much larger number of patrons going in than coming out. We walked in to find that every single party (there were 6 or 8 groups of people that had entered) had been seated and there were no open tables. The host said, "It doesn't look like things are working out in your favor today," and asked us if we had ever been to Leroy Fox, the restaurant next door. The birthday boy restated that it was his birthday and he had really hoped to eat there, and the host surveyed the dining room and pointed and said, "Well, it's going to be a while," and seated the people behind us that we had just held the door for 5 minutes prior. I've worked in the restaurant industry for 5 years and I've seen 16 year old girls do his job better than him, and they could do it while flirting with 30 year old servers and texting under the host stand. Eddies, find a new host/hostess!! We want your food!

OTcjW8QR8FgnnQizkYlQGA.text: excellent breakfasts - you can build your very own fluffy omelet and they don't charge for each item. their breakfast sandwiches are delicious too - i recommend egg, smoked sausage and cheese -mmmmm. The She-Crab soup is truly the BEST i have every had - from coast to coast - utterly divine.

g-oHXFgJ4tDnX30cmbLUwA.text: I love this place. This is the picture perfect neighborhood bar with the BEST She Crab Soup I have ever had.  The service is great and the bar tenders are great people to have a conversation with. The beer selection is good and the daily specials are great.  If you are looking for a relaxed atmosphere with great service, look no further.

dHD-_KvpFc8LZUywIIhajg.text: Oh how I love a good breakfast place close to my house for those weekend mornings when I just want some delicious food without the hassle of making it and cleaning up. And Eddie's definitely fits that criteria; conveniently located in Cotswold, their breakfast is solid every time. We've been to Eddie's quite a bit, and tend to hit it up at least once on weekends when we have quests in town.   If you're going to try to go during peak breakfast hours on the weekend, be ready for a wait as they offer $4.00 mimosas and bloody mary's (made with zing zang, which is the best bloody mary mix available). The tables turn pretty quickly, but the place just isn't that big. Service is generally very good, and we've never had to ask for drink refills.   Eddie's generally has pretty good breakfast specials, and if you like coffee, it's a-ok. The omelets, french toast and pancakes are all very good. And they offer turkey sausage and great hash browns to round out your breakfast experience.   If you're in the area, give Eddie's a try!

iPMVD4fdGaSK9jhGXSb3GA.text: This is a solid place for breakfast. I've only had their breakfast items and never ordered anything off of their regular menu since their specials always look fantastic and creative in thought. It's a small place with fast service, strong coffee, reasonable prices and generous portions. I love that they put "No business meetings" in between 11A-2P on their menu to prevent people just milling around.

vxsT6sNzDMVi3SuGcDxUGQ.text: This is a great place for all. Tuesdays--prime rib for $1 per ounce!  Also their shrimp and grits are out of this world.

OBhRHdJclAL_3VvhRFanGA.text: A great local restaurant with good atmosphere, however the food left something to be desired.  Small portion, not the freshest fruit and overcooked fries. But, it could have just been my meal, which is why I'll give it three.

OrWlIjDej4e3jB9cEXcnZg.text: Always great to be at Eddie's. Never had a bad meal here. Fried Pickles, Chicken Salad, Chef Salad, or even breakfast.... it's always good!

63K9WLwcZA_Mg4NXrm0FBQ.text: Well, we were jonesin for some of their delicious french toast and decided to go to Eddie's Pl.  Well, the wait was short, yet it took a good five minutes to be acknowledged. That was a huge negative, but we were craving the french toast and decided to let it slide. French toast was great, but too bad Eddie's gotten cheap and discontinued the homestyle fries-- you now get a 1/2 cup of flavorless and tepid regular ole hashbrowns.They were not even crispy browned. Talk about disa-ppoin-ted.  Eddie's is known for the old hashbrowns, french toast and she-Crab soup!???  Oh well, service was adequate and we could not wait to get the check.  I have never tried lunch, but this visit makes me want to file Eddie's into file 13.  We made a special trip to this side of town, but will only consider going back if we happen to be STARving and in the area. Another one bites the dust...

Raz7np9-Es0de8IM59C8Kw.text: This is my favorite Restaurant in town!  Great Rueben and the she crab soup is a must.  I always sit at the bar because the bartender Ben is the best at his craft in Charlotte!  Even when he's slammed he greets you and goes ahead and grabs me my usual bud light. He goes above and beyond with his great service.  I just love this place and tell people about it all the time.  You gotta check out Eddie's Place!

FOo1Sx93mIewfiU8l6aISA.text: Yeah. I tried this place for the first time Saturday and based off the reviews it seemed like it was too good to be True! Well I was wrong. It really is just that good!!! Its a family down to earth restarurant with unsually good food and service! We had Shrimp and Grits, She-crab soup, and The Cajun Chicken Pasta!   Every single item was to die for!! I thoroughly enjoyed it and I got a Shrimp and grits plus another She-crab soup to go !!  If you don't try the she crab soup ,you are SLEEPING!!!!!!  Whilst I was there, a guy beside me in the next booth ordered a bowl of she crab for there , a cup of she crab to go and another bowl of she crab to go. Need I say anymore?? The owner must be from New orleans or something because its not the taste of some restaurant guy who wants to put cajun or creole items on his menu but can't make it taste authentic. It taste like someone that KNOWS what their doing.  MY HAT goes off to the chef(s)!!

v11JHu66-kHL4X-7N13Y5w.text: I've been for lunch three times.  We had fabulous food every time.  Menu selection is very original. Prime rib sandwich is the best I've ever had. The wait staff is efficient but kinda dry.  Overall this one is a keeper.

DoiPfTD5OU4zkVxdOamijw.text: Went for the mimosas. The french toast said ciabatta so my friend asked the bartender. He spoke very highly about it so we tried it. To our surprise, that was the best French toast I've ever eaten and the mimosas had a great balance. Great place and I'll be back.

m7Vdh2z9jIxpAZPjYh2z_g.text: Good atmosphere.  Have been here a couple of times the food is really good.  For breakfast you can't beat the french toast and I had a burger for lunch which was above average.  Overall reccomended.

Bc1zFLutYvHr4zghg4ONxg.text: Great place for French toast with bacon and cheesy grits. Was great.

ib0b3pkf-nv2Y8qtLmhEPg.text: The food here was excellent and simply perfect for breakfast.  I would definitely suggest going here to eat some delicious hash browns, pancakes, and eggs.  Good coffee too. I just had a few problems with the environment and service.  I am usually all for alcohol with any meal, but they were being so pushy about having a bloody mary or a mamosa on a Sunday morning.  Eddie's Place is more a bar that happens to serve breakfast.  I just think it works better the other way around.  (See my Egg Heads review).  The price was reasonable and maybe I could give this place 4 stars, but would rate it a 3.9. I still say.. Enjoy and give it a try..  -Ian M.

wCEE08gXj35O-xKTnpBTRQ.text: I went to Eddie's place for breakfast with my fiance.  The overall execution of the meal was poor which is very important for breakfast in my opinion. The apple juice was cold and delicious. I got a traditional eggs Benedict. The eggs were poached long enough to become hard boiled and the English muffin had no texture. The hollandaise and the ham were both good.  My fiance got the steak and eggs over easy. The steak was cooked just right and delicious. The eggs were undercooked and raw in parts.  The service was adequate but our server did not ask how our food tasted nor did she seem to care that I had two hard balls of yolk left on the plate from the Benedict.  We spent $40 before tip.  I will not be visiting this restaurant a second time.
